loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Riza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods like curtains, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

Riza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods like curtains, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир житель района Хамадони. Ему 32 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Тохир зарабатывает на жизнь путем продажи топливо. Он на больших канистрах и баках приобретает топливо оптом и розничный продает их. Он имеет не большое место, где он поставил свои баки. Тохир заправляет машины топливом с помощью трехлитровой стеклянной банки вручную. Тохир очень давно хотел купить аппарат по разливу топливо, но не имеет достаточно денег. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Тохир надеется получить недостающую сумму денег и купить аппарат. Тохир надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Tohir live in Hamadoni, and is 32 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Tohir earns a living selling fuel.  He buys large cans and tanks of fuel wholesale and then resells the fuel.  He has a small place where he puts his tanks and fills cars manually with a three liter glass jar.  Tohir has long wanted to purchase a fuel dispenser, but does not have enough money to do so.  For this reason he is asking for a loan, and is hoping to receive enough money to buy the dispenser.  Tohir is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a fuel dispenser

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic bags and sponges.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy underwear and nail polish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a businesswoman in the countryside of Kyabugimbi-Bushenyi, where she has been for the last thirteen years. She trades in agricultural produce on a small scale, working seven days a week. In addition to the produce business, she also buys and sells cattle at a profit, which has helped her meet the needs of her family.

Rose thanks Kiva lenders for the previous loan which she used to buy produce and make profits. She would like to use this loan (5,000,000 UGX) to buy more produce, in the form of dry corn and beans. She will sell this and earn profits, which will be used to expand her business and educate her children. Her clients are mainly school owners who buy beans and corn as food for their students. Her biggest challenge is delayed payments, since some people take items on credit with the hope of paying back in time, which they never do. Despite the challenge of delayed payments, Rose is determined and hopeful that the loan will pay up and the business will grow to make her financially independent.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell.

loans.name: Pertaap

texts.en:
Pertaap is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for helping him realize his dream. He has fully repaid his loan. With the loan of SRD 8,000 he was able to expand his production and save for the future of his family.

He needs another loan for the next season since rice cultivation requires high cost inputs like fertilizer, seeds and diesel.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rutendo

texts.en: Rutendo is a 23-year-old businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing for all ages and genders for five months now. She was encouraged by the other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into the business. When she is not working, Rutendo serves as a Cama member who volunteers to clean toilets in schools within her community. With the requested loan Rutendo intends to make bulk purchases of clothing so that she can boost her sales volume and profits. With the additional profits she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment for people in her community and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing

loans.name: Tsupo

texts.en: Tsupo is a 24-year-old single mother of one child, living in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe.  She sells cookies, sweets, chips, and matches in her community. She has been running this business for six months now. Tsupo is also a Learner Guide at the nearby secondary school where she has been working to help drop-outs return to school.  With the requested loan from Kiva, she plans to purchase more sweets, matches, and snacks. With the additional profits, Tsupo would like to further her education, go to a teacher’s college, and train to become a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase more sweets, matches and snacks.

loans.name: Inyishu Group

texts.fr:
Tatu  fait partie du groupe  Inyishu  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 45 ans et est marié à Hussein, un garagiste. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 7 à 24 ans.

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis  15 ans. 

Elle  est   à  son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, elle voudrait construire une maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Tatu belongs to group Inyishu and lives in Bujumbura. She is 45 years old and married to Hussein, a mechanic. Together they have eight children aged seven to twenty-four.

She has been in the clothing trade for fifteen years. This is her fifth loan with Turame. With the loan obtained through Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy many clothes for resale, in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many clothes for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is an old client aged 23 years. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Two million shillings only) to buy more cows for milk production. He will sell the milk to earn income to meet his family's needs. He is still single with no children. He is a farmer specializing in zero grazing for milk production. He is a very hardworking man who works 12 hours a day and 7 days a week. He started his business in the year 2004 to have an income to sustain him. The business is being carried on from a village in Nyakabirizi Division, Bushenyi District and his clients are all kinds of people but mostly schools which have helped him to grow from one level to another. He is faced with the challenge of competition from other farmers of the same category but is ready to grow through his hard work. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable in the future. He thanks Ugafode and Kiva lenders for a job well done.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Astrie

texts.en:
Astrie thanks all Kiva Lenders for helping her to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. She has repaid her loan to Kiva lenders on time. She could also save some money for the future and for the education of her children.

She approaches Seva MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of SRD 10,000 to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and continue production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy haberdashery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Wensislao

texts.es:
Wensislao tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto con sus padres en su casa de material rústico en el caserío San Juan Pampa, una zona rural del Distrito Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de papas, maíz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de salud pública en el Caserío aledaño de Lanchepata, se desempeña como enfermero atendiendo a los moradores con inyecciones, medición de presión arterial, indicaciones para el cuidado de niños de 0 -3 años, es conocido en dicha comunidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternatva de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wensislao is 26 years old and lives with his parents in their home made of local materials in the rural settlement of San Juan Pampa, a rural area in Santo Tomas district, located in Cutervo province, which is part of the Cajamarca region in Perú's northern highlands. The people who live there engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of potatoes and corn, the sale of these, and livestock-raising.  

He provides public health services in the neighboring settlement of Lanchepata. He works as a nurse, looking after the needs of the inhabitants with injections, measuring blood pressure, and giving recommendations for the care of children from 0-3 years old. He is well known in this community.

He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to buy a dairy cow which will allow him to generate greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow which will allow him to generate greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sanganya est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre de la banque villageoise «Alpha», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgé de 34ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est   vendeuse de la boisson sucrée. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un dépôt du centre commercial, qu’elle loue conjointement avec ses collègues du même secteur d’activité. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 20 caisses de sucrées. Ainsi, il souhaite  scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Our client Sanganya is a courageous merchant, member and president of the village financial association “Alpha,” senior entrepreneur, and very dynamic. She is 34 years old, married, and a mother of seven children who all go to school.

This client sells sweetened beverages. She displays her merchandise at a store in the mall, which she rents together with her colleagues in the same business. She started her business with seed capital received from her husband; later, she benefited from a Hekima loan. She has been in this business for eight years.

This new loan will be used to purchase 20 cases of sweetened beverage. This is how she sends her children to school and feeds them. To conclude, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of sweetened drinks.

loans.name: Krishne

texts.en:
Krishne is very happy with all of the help he received from Kiva lenders, and thanks you a lot.

Krishne could save some money for his children's future higher education costs. He needs to save more, because the small savings he made to date will not be enough. That’s why he will continue cultivating rice. For this, he needs another loan of SRD 8,000 for the purchase of inputs, such as diesel and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Nahum De Jesus

texts.es:
Nahúm, es un joven emprendedor, atiende una venta de celulares y accesorios, también ofrece el servicio de reparación para los mismos, el nombre de su negocio es “ACTIVACIÓN VILLAFRANCO”,  ya tiene  7 años de poseerlo, en sus inicios sus padres le proporcionaron capital de trabajo, ha tenido la responsabilidad de administrar su negocio y poco a poco lo ha mejorado. Nahúm está acompañado, por el momento no tiene  hijos; su compañera de vida le apoya en atender el negocio.
Con el capital comprara celulares, carcasas, cargadores, chips, manos libres, memorarías, etc., surtirá l inventario con nuevos modelos de celulares con lo que espera tener mejores utilidades, atraer nuevos clientes y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta lograr que sea autosuficiente, continuar preparándose académicamente y tener un buen patrimonio para cuando lleguen sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Nahúm is an enterprising young man and runs a shop selling cell phones and accessories. He also offers repair service for these. The name of his business is “ACTIVACIÓN VILLAFRANCO.” He has owned it for seven years now. At the beginning his parents provided him working capital. He has had the responsibility of running the business and little by little has improved it. Nahúm lives with his partner, for the moment has no children, and his life companion helps him run the shop.

With the loan he will buy cell phones, cases, chargers, chips, headsets, memory, etc. and will stock his inventory with new cell phone models, with which he hopes to have better profits, attract new customers and repay the debt. 

His dream is to expand his business until it is self-sufficient, to continue his academic education and to have a good patrimony for when his future children arrive.

loans.use: To buy cell phones, cases, chargers, chips, headsets, memory, etc.

loans.name: Wishnoe

texts.en:
Wishnoe is very grateful to know how Kiva lenders help him realize his long term goals.

He repaid his loan of last season fully. With the profits, he was able to save for his own house.

He asks for more help from Kiva lenders to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production so he can save more and start building.

He needs a new loan of SRD 8,000 for this.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Manodj

texts.en:
Manodj thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time and was able to save some money for his children's education. Manodj was also able to expand his rice areas with the profits from this loan.

He is approaching Seva MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, es parte de un hogar en el cual junto a su esposo se dedican a cuidar de sus dos hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad; como actividad económica para cubrir parte de las necesidades de su familia ella atiende una sala de belleza en la que ofrece el servicio de cortes de cabello, tratamientos faciales, uñas acrílicas, etc., no representa dificultades en este momento.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de una silla para cortar cabello, un espejo grande, cosméticos, tratamientos faciales y para cabello, tintes, entre otros productos básicos para tener a sus clientes satisfechos, le será de mucha ayuda para equipar su negocio y tener ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Marta is part of a household where together with her husband they devote themselves to looking after their two children, ages six and one. As a business for covering part of the family's needs, she runs a beauty salon where she offers the service of cutting hair, facial treatments, acrylic nails, etc. She doesn't have business difficulties at this time.

She will use the loan to purchase a chair for cutting hair, a large mirror, cosmetics, facial treatments, hair treatments, dyes, and other basic products for satisfying her customers' needs. 

It will be a great help to her for equipping her business and having income with which to pay off her debt. Her dream is to continue working so that she can offer her family a better standard of living and have their own home.

loans.use: To buy a chair for cutting hair, a large mirror, cosmetics, facial treatments, hair treatments, dyes, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for administrative processes related to her thesis.

loans.name: Gladys Yessenia

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 28 años de edad y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Odontología y desde hace algunos años ejerce su profesión en un Consultorio Dental cerca de la zona donde reside. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante por eso lucha día tras día para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Gladys está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar los trámites de actualización de su carrera de Odontología. De esta manera seguirá luchando para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su Clínica dental para brindar un servicio de calidad a la sociedad".
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising woman of 28, who lives in Parcona with her family. She studied the career of dentistry, and has practiced her profession for some years in a dental clinic near the area where she lives. She is a person with a great desire to succeed, and that is why she struggles day after day so that she can improve her family's quality of life. 

Gladys is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have offered she will be able to carry out the administrative procedures for updating her dentistry degree. In this way she will continue struggling to someday fulfill her great dream: "To have a dental clinic for providing quality service to society."

loans.use: To pay for administrative procedures related to updating her education.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, está acompañada, vive con su familia integrada por su compañero de vida y dos hijas; junto a su pareja se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos, lo realizan desde hace 10 años, trabajan de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde. 
Invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, insecticidas, herbicidas y plaguicidas, se limitara a comprar lo necesario para preparar el terreno y asegurar una buena cosecha, esperar tener mejores ingresos para poder cancelar su deuda y abastecer a su familia de lo necesario para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
Su aspiración es mantenerse trabajando para brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is in a relationship, and lives with her family composed of her life partner and two daughters. She and her partner make a living cultivating basic grains. They have done this for the last ten years, working from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon.

She will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, seed, insecticides, herbicides and pesticides, and will limit herself to buying what is necessary to prepare the land and ensure a good harvest. She hopes to have better returns in order to be able to pay off her debt and provide what is necessary for her family to meet their basic needs.

Her aspiration is to keep working to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticides, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado pues por la situación económica no pudo seguir con sus estudios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, sus 4 hijos viven con él, solo 2 están estudiando por lo que son 5 personas que dependen de Daniel


Él toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, además compra ganado que al termino de 1 año ve las ganancias, él se traslada en bicicleta 5 kilómetros para poder llegar hasta donde tiene su parcela y no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.

Daniel solicita este préstamo para comprar un novillo, pues tiene 1 y quiere tener la yunta de bueyes.

Él sueña con salir adelante con su trabajo, poder tener ganado de repasto y tener una vivienda digna donde pueda vivir junto a su esposa, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y de los créditos podrá hacerlo posible.
texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old and studied through the fifth grade. Due to his financial situation, he was not able to continue his education. Daniel is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household chores. His four children live with him, but only two of them are studying. In total, he has five people who are dependent on him.

Daniel has spent his entire life working in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his parents. In addition, he buys cattle and is able to turn a profit at the end of one year. He travels five kilometers on a bicycle in order to reach his plot land. Daniel does not have an established work schedule.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy a young bull. He already has one in his possession, so he wants another one so that he can yoke them together for plowing. Daniel’s dream is to get ahead in his work, own cattle for grazing, and have a decent home where he and his wife can live. He knows that with help from God and from the loans, these goals are possible.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for plowing.

loans.name: Rakesh

texts.en:
Rakesh is very happy with the help of all the Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot. He repaid his loan fully and the profits helped him save for his sister's marriage.
 
Rakesh is asking Seva MFI and Kiva lenders to help him with another loan of SRD 11,000 to continue rice production so he can save more.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a 22-year-old single mother of one living in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe with her daughter. Abigail has been selling clothes at a flea market for three months now. She also volunteers in her local school where she provides information to young people on topics including HIV/AIDS and life skills. With the Kiva loan, she will purchase more clothing to sell in order to receive higher profits. With these additional profits, she would like to send her child to school and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es:
Héctor, mantuvo su negocio funcionando por la buena cosecha que obtuvo de maíz, abasteció a su familia y sus clientes, tanto de maíz en grano como en elote, con las nuevas ganancias él ha tenido un buen desarrollo económico, puesto que cancelo su deuda, optimizo el estilo de vida familiar y logro comprar un vehículo, esto fue posible por la inversión del crédito anterior.  
Nuevamente opta por más capital para seguir trabajando y aprovechar la época de siembra, lo invertirá en comprar 2 sacos de abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla y herbicidas; de esta manera contara con los ingresos que necesita para costear sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Héctor keeps his business running with the good harvest of corn that he obtains. He supplies his family and his customers with grains of corn and corn cobs. With his new earnings, he has experienced great financial growth. Since he was able to pay his debts, he was able to improve his family's way of life and purchase a vehicle. This was possible due to the previous loan.
  
Now, he would like more capital to continue working and taking advantage of the planting season. He will invest in the purchase of two bags of manure, insecticides, pesticides, seeds, and herbicides. This way, he will have the income that he needs to pay his obligations.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of manure, insecticides, pesticides, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de piña y crianza de animales,la socia ya tiene tiempo en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar piñas y gallinas.

La socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her business of selling pineapples and raising animals. She has been in business for quite some time and is doing very well. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pineapples and chickens.

The borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. This loan is part of a line of credit products offered by Asociación Araiwa known as “Credi Yapa”, which is offered to borrowers who have a good credit history.

The borrower is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy pineapples and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Santiaga

texts.es:
María, manifiesta que el invertir créditos en su negocio le da buenos resultados para ella y su familia, por lo que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, concentrado y maicillo, tendrá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y contara con alimento para las aves de corral y cerdos que tiene.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro la rentabilidad de su negocio, atrajo nuevos clientes y junto a su familia viven en mejores circunstancias. Con el firme propósito de fortalecer su negocio ha comprado cerdos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria states that investing loans in her business provides good results for her and her family. For this reason she decided to request a new loan in order to buy corn, wood, concentrated animal feed and sorghum. She will have the raw material for her tortilla sales and will have food for her poultry and pigs. 

With the previous loan, she increased the profitability of her business and attracted new customers. She and her family live in better conditions. Firmly resolved to strengthening her business, she bought pigs in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, concentrated animal feed and sorghum.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, solicita un nuevo financiamiento con el fin de seguir mejorando el inventario de su tienda y la venta de verduras, comprara tomates, cebollas,  pipianes, güisquiles, papas, boquitas, aceite, condimentos, papel higiénico, bebidas, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
El efecto que le dio el crédito anterior en su negocio ha sido muy positivo porque se mantiene generando ingresos para ir progresando junto a su familia y cancelando sus cuotas muy puntuales.
texts.en:
Teresa requests a new loan with the goal of continuing to improve the inventory of her store and the vegetable sales. She will buy tomatoes, onions, pipian squash, chayote squash, potatoes, snacks, oil, condiments, toilet paper, and drinks, among others as needed to meet customer demand.

The prior loan has had a positive impact on her business because she gets by generating income and making progress along with her family and paying her debts very promptly.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, pipian squash, chayote squash, potatoes, snacks, oil, condiments, toilet paper, drinks and other supplies

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 66 años de edad,  lastimosamente no estudio por la pobreza de sus padres. Él tenía que trabajar y ayudar a mantener a su familia, sus hijos ya mayores de edad ya con su propia familia no dependen de él, vive con su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de pescado.

Juan se ha dedicado a trabajar desde que era muy pequeño en compañía de su padre y hermanos el cultivo de maíz y también a la pesca en la laguna de la comunidad, hoy en día solo se dedica a trabajar la agricultura debido a la edad se le hace difícil y se ha dedicado más de lleno a la agricultura y al cultivo de plátano, esto lo hace todos los días ya que se tiene que ir por semanas completas donde tiene el cultivo, porque esta muy lejos de su casa a más de 20 kilómetros  de su casa y se le hace muy difícil trasladarse todos los días ya que no hay un medio de trasporte que pueda ser utilizado para tal fin, su esposa le ayuda a los oficios domésticos y al comercio de pescado y con esto a pagar los recibos de los servicios básicos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas,  para preparar la tierra para que sea productiva.

Las aspiraciones a futuro son seguir trabajando,  valerse por sí mismo y trabajar con su esposa y poder terminar de comprar una tierra para sus nietos.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old. Unfortunately, he didn't study because of his parents' poverty. He had to work and help provide for his family. His children are of age, with families of their own and they don't depend on him. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker and also sells fish.

Juan has worked from the time he was very young, in the company of his father and his brothers, in cultivating corn and also fishing in the town lake. Nowadays, he just works in agriculture because age makes things more difficult for him, so he has dedicated more time to agriculture and the cultivation of plantains. He does this every day because he has go for the whole week to where he has his crop, because it's very far from his house, more than 20 kilometers from his house. It's difficult for him to travel every day because there isn't any transportation that he can use to do that. His wife helps with the housework and sells fish, and with that they pay for basic services [utilities]. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides and herbicides for preparing the land so it will be productive.

His aspirations for the future are to continue working, earning his own money, and working with his wife, and to be able to buy a piece of land for his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides and herbicides for preparing the land so it will be productive.

loans.name: Tomas Eduardo

texts.es:
Tomas, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para adquirir de manera inmediata los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cultivar maíz y mejorar el desarrollo de la platanera que posee, comprara abono, semilla, insecticidas, plaguicidas y pago de mozos que le ayuden a limpiar la maleza de la propiedad.
Con el préstamo anterior ha logrado proteger la platanera y el cultivo de maíz de plagas, mejoro su productividad y la situación económica es más favorable.
texts.en:
Tomas needs a new loan to buy immeadiately the agricultural inputs necessary for cultivating corn and to improve the quality of the plaintain farms that he owns. He will buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and pay for laborers who will help him to clear weeds from his property. 

With the previous loan, he has been able to protect the plantain farm and the corn crop from pests. He increased his productivity and his economic situation is more favorable.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops because he needs them to be fertilized well to get a better harvest and obtain more income

loans.name: Pedro Gustavo

texts.es:
Pedro, manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar suficiente producto para comercializarlo, tener ingresos que le sirven para costear los gastos familiares y mantener su buen record crediticio.
Debido a que tuvo que dar mantenimiento al camión de trabajo se ha quedado descapitalizado y por ello opta por un nuevo crédito que le permita seguir trabajando, comprara maleza, para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro reports that he was able to buy enough product to market with his previous loan to make enough income to pay for his household expenses and maintain a good credit record.

He has had to get his work truck maintenanced, and since this has left him without funds he is asking for a new loan that will allow him to keep working and buy molasses to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy molasses

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
Jessica Paola tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una zona del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada para damas, caballeros y niños, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa por temporada de invierno como casacas, abrigos, chompas de lana, buzos entre otros y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica Paola is 35 years old and lives with her parents in a neighborhood within the District of Bueno Aires. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Jessica sells seasonal clothing for women, men, and children. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN in order to buy seasonal clothing for winter such as jackets, coats, wool sweaters, sweatshirts, and other items that she can offer to her customers. This will help her generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing such as jackets, coats, wool sweaters, sweatshirts, and other items.

loans.name: Iragi Bus Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kishaka est une brave commerçante, conseillère et membre d’un collectif  d’affaires «Iragi Bus »,entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée  et mère de 7 enfants dont 5 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires  Elle installe sa marchandise sur la rue du quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec le fonds reçu  après la récolte dans son champs .Son conjoint est un  fonctionnaire dans une maison de gardiennage. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, post conflit à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu'un client porte son enfant.
texts.en:
The member Kishaka is a worthy merchant, counselor and member of the "Iragi Bus" business group. She is a 36-year-old entrepreneur, married and mother of seven children, of whom five are in school and two are still kids. Her husband is an employee in a home security company.

The client sells foodstuffs. She displays her goods on a street in a busy area of the city. She started her business with funds obtained after harvesting her field. Later she was granted a loan from the Hekima MFI. She has been performing this activity for the past six years.

This new loan will serve to buy one bag of potatoes. She wants to increase her working capital, and educate, clothe and feed her children.

Finally, she greatly thanks Hekima for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical post-conflict time in the Eastern part of the country. It should be noted that a member is carrying her child.

loans.use: buy one bag of potatoes

loans.name: Ntombizodwa

texts.en:
Ntombizodwa is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in the Umguza District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. 

Ntombizodwa has been selling clothes at a flea market for six months and is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing stock levels. 

Apart from her business, she also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide, leading sessions on wellbeing and life skills in schools. 

With her additional profits, Ntombizodwa hopes to continue her education so that she can improve her knowledge.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas, y coordinado por la señora Sadia con 32 años de edad y soltera ha emprendido un nuevo negocio se dedica a vender cosméticos y ropa nueva anteriormente solo vendía golosinas y helados el propósito del crédito es invertir mercadería como es cremas corporales, cremas para el cabello, perfumes para dama y caballeros, body corporales, vanidades, rubores, delineadores, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores invirtió y con las ganancias impulso el negocio de la venta de cosmético. Otra de las socias es la señora Rosario de 45 años de edad quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortilla en su domicilio este negocio lo impulso hace doce años, y la Señora Gilma de 57 años  de edad ofrece el servicio de comida principalmente sopas además se dedica a la agricultura desde hace diez años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three industrious members. The coordinator is Sra. Sadia, who is 32 years old and single. She started a new business of selling cosmetics and new clothes. Sadia previously sold snack foods and ice cream. The purpose of her loan is to invest in merchandise such as body crèmes, hair crèmes, perfumes for women and men, body moisturizers, compacts, blushes, eyeliners, and other products. After she invested her previous loans, she used the profits to start her cosmetics business.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Rosario is 45 years old. She makes and sells tortillas from her home. Her business was started 12 years ago.
• Sra. Gilma is 57 years old and offers food service. She sells mostly soups. In addition, she has been farming for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy body crèmes, hair crèmes, perfumes for women and men, body moisturizers, compacts, blushes, eyeliners, and other products.

loans.name: José Irene

texts.es:
José  de 37 años de edad, él no asistió a la escuela debido a que sus padres no le daban  la importancia. José esta casado y es padre de un hijo. 

 José se a dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura,  esa era la actividad que sus padres desarrollaban todos los días,  y es lo que José practica hoy en día.

 Además,  José se dedica a revender mercadería.


El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que ha cultivado 8,750 metros cuadrados  de maíz y necesita darle una buena nutrición a su  cultivo y dándole un  buena nutrición los resultados serán más beneficiosos y  la cosecha rendirá más.

Los sueños a futuro son  poder tener un mejor préstamo para cultivar mas, además poder trabajar  las hortalizas, ya que son muy rentables y obtener unos mejores ingresos , y poder ayudar a su hijo a que estudie y sea un profesional para el bien de la sociedad.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He didn't attend school because it wasn't important to his parents. José is married and is the father of a son. 

José has worked in agriculture from the time he was very young. This was the work his parents did every day, and it's what José does today.

José also re-sells merchandise. 

The loan that he needs is for buying fertilizer, because he has cultivated 8,750 square meters of the corn and he needs to give good nutrition to his crop. By giving it good nutrition, he will have better results and a bigger harvest.

His dreams for the future are to obtain a better loan so he can cultivate more, and also to farm vegetables because they are more profitable and bring in better income. He would also like to be able to help his son to study and become a professional for the good of society.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop so he can have a bigger harvest.

loans.name: Epitone

texts.en:
Epitone is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in Zimbabwe’s Kwekwe District where she has been running a fleamarket business for the past six months with assistance from her family members. She also assists in local schools and hospitals doing cleaning. She also volunteers offering guidance and counseling lessons to students in nearby secondary schools in her community. 

Epitone intends to purchase high quality and fashionable clothes with the requested Kiva loan in order to become more competitive in the business and increase her sales. With increased profits she wants to make her business grow, create employment in her community and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase high quality and fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Thubelihle

texts.en:
Thubelihle is a 20-year-old businesswoman who has been successfully rearing traditional broiler chickens from her home. She has produced batches of 30 birds every six weeks for the past two years. Thubelihle is also a volunteer in her community and assists the elderly in their fields. 

With the loan from Kiva she will expand her business by purchasing 100 broiler chicks, chick feed and vaccines.  Broiler chickens are in high demand and are easy to rear. With additional profits she plans to further her education and go to a college where she could be trained as an agriculturalist.

loans.use: To purchase 100 broiler chicks, chick feed and vaccines.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer aged 43 who works in coffee farming. He is married with 6 children aged 21, 18, 16, 15, 11 and 9 years old, and only 3 attend school. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (two million, five hundred thousand shillings) to buy coffee seeds for his coffee farming. He started his business in 2011 from a rural area in Katenga, Ruhinda, Mitooma, in order to have an income to sustain him and his family. He is a hardworking man and works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. His clients are coffee traders. He is faced with the challenge of competition among other farmers but works hard to beat the competition. He hopes the hard work and the loans will start to pay off soon.

He thanks the Kiva lenders for the tremendous work they are doing.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy food products (maize, beans)

loans.name: Narinder

texts.en:
Narinder is feeling blessed and is very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. 

With the profits of last season he paid the tuition fees and bought school books for his children. He also saved for their future.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time and requests them to lend him SRD 10,000 once more to purchase diesel and fertilizers for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a 22-year-old mother of one. For the past year, Carol has worked selling clothes at a local flea market, while still volunteering with CAMA, Camfed’s alumnae network in her community. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Carol intends to begin ordering clothing in bulk from wholesalers to be more cost-effective. She hopes to use her additional profits to become financially independent and to assist her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is a 30-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the Kwekwe district of Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. 

In 2013, she opened a flea market stand where she sells clothes for adults and children. Her family members help her in the business since she cannot afford to employ anyone at the moment. Edina also volunteers as a Learner Guide in schools in her community, teaching life skills. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she will buy more clothes to sell at the flea market. Her plan is to purchase from wholesalers at lower prices and resell the merchandise at affordable prices. This will help her to grow her client base and increase profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business, own a boutique and create employment for the people in her community.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell at her flea market stand.

loans.name: Emelly

texts.en:
Emelly is a 23-year-old married entrepreneur who lives in Zimbabwe’s Kwekwe district with her husband and one child. She is operating a business selling clothing and shoes at the local  flea market and has been doing this for nine months with assistance from her husband. Apart from the business that she runs, Emelly also volunteers in her community assisting the elderly by fetching water for them and working in their fields. 

With the support from a Kiva loan, Emelly plans to purchase clothes in bulk. By buying in bulk, she will be able to purchase new merchandise at a reasonable price and sell the items for a profit. With additional profits,  Emelly will expand her business, create employment for her community and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk so as to increase the profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her grandson's school fees.

loans.name: Nozipho

texts.en:
Nozipho lives with her family in the Umguza district in Zimbabwe. 

Over the past four months, she has been successfully selling clothing at a local flea market in her community. With the requested loan, Nozipho intends to expand her business, which she hopes will ultimately allow her to employ more community members. 

In addition to working in her shop, she maintains her involvement with CAMA, Camfed’s alumnae network, where she volunteers with the elderly population in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and expand her business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora nace mediante la gestión de una de las integrantes de este grupo. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Teresa, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Lo que quiere decir que debe seguir esforzándose por mejorar. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene ventas de ropa usada y a la vez es limpiadora, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones. La Sra. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de ropas, lo que le será de mucha ayuda para poder surtirse y seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Maria Auxiliadora” was started by one of the members of this group. It is located in the city of San Lorenzo. The members indicated that their main objective is for each of them to grow. They have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that six of them are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Sra. Teresa. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This indicates that she must continue striving in order to improve. The work that she performs includes selling used clothes and housekeeping. Teresa also mentions the work of the advisors, who are constantly providing training and verification.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes. This will be of great help because she can restock her business and continue to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy cassava and palm nuts

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, por lo tanto su pareja e hijos dependen de él.  


Rubén actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde niño, lo aprendió de sus padres y además trabaja como jornalero lo que le deja un ingreso económico adicional, para llegar donde trabaja como jornalero se traslada 2 kilómetros en bicicleta, su horario es de 6:00 a 11:00 AM.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para invertir en la siembra de maíz, pues en este mes es donde los agricultores empiezan a movilizarse para trabajar la temporada.


Los sueños de Rubén son tener una vivienda digna donde pueda vivir con su familia, ver crecer a sus hijos y darles el estudio necesario para que consigan un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Rubén is 34 years old and studied through the sixth grade. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. Rubén has three children, two of whom are studying. His partner and children are the ones who are dependent on him.

Rubén currently works in agriculture and has done so since he was a child. He learned the trade from his parents and also works as a day laborer as a way of earning additional income. In order to get to his job as a day laborer, he must travel two kilometers on a bicycle. His schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 11:00 A.M.

The money from this loan will be invested in the planting of corn. The farmers have started to mobilize this month in order to begin the work for this season. Rubén dreams of having a decent home where he can live with his family, seeing his children grow, and providing them the necessary education that will allow them to secure good jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock .

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia vive con su madre que es soltera, su abuela y un hermano menor, su madre tiene un comedor que maneja con la abuela. Silvia trabaja en una empresa como operadora desde hace 1 año, viaja todos los días muy temprano y se queda luego para ir a la Facultad, luego vuelve a su casa ya por las noches, ella afirma que es sacrificado y cansador pero ya le queda poco más de un año para terminar y se siente animada para hacerlo.
Solicita el préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a seguir estudiando y seguir luchando por sus metas de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her mother who is a single parent, her grandmother, and a younger brother. Her mother has a diner that she manages with her grandmother. Silvia has been working at a company as an operator for the past year.

Every day she must travel early and then stay late in order to attend school. She returns home at night. Silvia says that her schedule is tiring and requires sacrifice, but she has a little more than a year to go before she finishes. Therefore, she is motivated to continue.

Silvia is requesting a loan in order to cover her university fees. This will allow her to continue studying and striving toward her goals so that she can become a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is a small entrepreneur and a client of Kubo.financiero, and this is his story.

He is 32 years old, married and has one son. He lives in a house with some relatives and makes a living by selling American clothing. He has been selling clothes for 6 years now. He is located in a central spot in his neighborhood near a crowded market and a dairy store, which means that many people pass by every day. 

He is asking for this loan to stock up his business and have more clothes to sell, in order to increase his sales and his income.

Miguel's main goal is to keep up the business and make it grow, and in the future he would like to open up more businesses of this type; he aspires to have up to five clothing-selling businesses.

loans.use: to stock up his business, which sells American clothing

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
En secundaria, Aurora descubrió su amor por la clase de Biología, era una de las estudiantes más aplicadas y con las mejores notas, siempre estaba al servicio de sus compañeras por si no comprendían la lección. En la actualidad cursa quinto año de la carrera de Biología, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y sin hijos. Es una joven inteligente y emprendedora, quien asegura que cada día es una oportunidad para adquirir nuevos conocimientos.
Aurora solicita el crédito para el pago de su titulación, puesto que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios. Además, ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, ya que anhela ser una profesional exitosa y certificada, esto lo logrará siempre y cuando obtenga su titulo de licenciada en Biología. Una de sus objetivos es trabajar como docente y poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos de manera que pueda contribuir en el desarrollo de su comunidad. Su principal apoyo en la lucha por seguir adelante, han sido su hermana y su tío, a quienes espera nunca defraudar.
texts.en:
In high school, Aurora discovered her love for biology. She was one of the more diligent students who earned good grades. Aurora always made herself available to classmates who did not understand the lesson. She is currently in her fifth year of her biology degree program. Aurora is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She is an intelligent and enterprising young woman who says that every day in an opportunity to acquire new knowledge.

Aurora is requesting a loan in order to pay for her degree since she does not have the necessary funds. In addition, she places her trust in this loan because she wants to become a successful certified professional. She will be able to achieve this goal when she obtains her degree in Biology.

One of her other goals is to work as a teacher and put the knowledge she acquired into practice. This will enable her to contribute to the development of her community. Her main support for moving forward has come from her sister and her uncle, who she hopes never to disappoint.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various clothing to sell.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María de 53 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º grado sus padres eran muy pobres y no alcanzaban a darle mucho estudio, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 10 hijos de los cuales solo 6 dependen de ella.

Actualmente María trabaja en la agricultura junto a su esposo y lo ha hecho desde que era niña, sus padres fueron los que le enseñaron este trabajo, se traslada 6 kilómetros en caballo con su esposo para llegar hasta donde tienen el terreno en el cual cultivan, horario de trabajo no tiene, pues hasta que terminan de hacer lo programado en ese día regresan a su casa.


Ella necesita este crédito para invertir en la siembra de maíz, ya que de esta actividad dependen económicamente y al no realizar no tendría el alimento diario..


El sueño de María es poder darles estudio a sus hijos para que ellos consigan un mejor trabajo, tener ganado de repasto para tener otros ingresos económicos y sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and studied through the second grade. Her parents were very poor and not able to pay for much education. María is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has 10 children, but only 6 of them are dependent on her.

María currently works in agriculture alongside her husband. She has been doing this since she was a girl since her parents taught her this line of work. María and her husband must travel six kilometers on horseback so that they can reach the plot of land that they cultivate. They do not have a set work schedule, so they return home whenever the day’s work is done.

María needs a loan so that she can invest in the planting of corn. She is financially dependent on this activity or else she will not have enough to eat. María dreams of providing an education for her children so that they can secure a good job, as well as having cattle for grazing as another source of income. María knows that with the help of God and the loans, she will be able to achieve these goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Monedas Group

texts.es:
Sonia Alexa: Es una mujer  amable y trabajadora. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia, desde hace un año estableció en su vivienda la venta de vigoron. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos: repollo, chicharon, yuca, tomates, vinagre, cebolla, sal, bolsas plásticas. Su sueño es establecer un salón de belleza.

Reyna: Solicita financiamiento para comprar productos para su salón de belleza: tinte de cabello, pinturas de uñas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su local. 

Aracely: Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería, para su pequeña pulpería. Su sueño es diversificar los productos que ofrece, vender pollo, mortadela y carne molida.
texts.en:
Sonia Alexa is a friendly and hardworking woman. Her goals are to have her own source of income and to improve her family’s quality of life. One year ago, she established in her home a business of selling “vigorón” (a traditional Nicaraguan cabbage salad). She is requesting her first loan in order to buy supplies such as cabbage, pork skins, cassava, tomatoes, vinegar, onions, salt, and plastic bags. Her dream is to open a beauty salon.

Reyna is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon such as hair dyes, nail polishes, and other products. Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her shop.

Aracely is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her small grocery store. Her dream is to diversify her product offerings by selling chicken, mortadela, and ground beef.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as cabbage, pork skins, cassava, tomatoes, vinegar, onions, salt, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es un joven que como todos ayuda a sus padres por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
Hector está estudiando y se prepara para ser un licenciado en educación física, de manera a poder, el día de mañana ser un buen maestro. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, cubrir ese gasto y seguir su meta de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Hector is a young man who, just like everyone, helps his parents through effort and sacrifice. He is a self-sacrificing individual who wants to get ahead.

Hector is studying and preparing to receive a degree in Physical Education in hopes of becoming a successful teacher some day. He is requesting a loan in order to pay his fees. By covering this expense, Hector will be able to continue with his goal of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Nefretiri Liliana

texts.es:
Nefretiri es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos y vive en Nazca junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año trabaja como Guardiana en el Coliseo Municipal, también desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de comida (pollo broaster, hamburguesas, salchipapa, etc.) cuando hay alguna festividad en la ciudad. Le va muy bien porque es responsable, luchadora y siempre trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para poder dar un mejor futuro a su familia.
Nefretiri está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para suministrar su negocio de venta de comida, de esta manera ella obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá utilizarlo para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Nefretiri, 46, is a very hard-working woman who is single and the mother of three children.  She lives in Nazca with her family and is very determined to get ahead.  For a year she has been working as a security guard at the Municipal Coliseum.  And, for some time, she also has been selling food (broasted chicken, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc.) during festivities in the city.  Things are going well for her because she is responsible and motivated and always making every effort toward  a better future for her family.

Nefretiri is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support she can buy merchandise for her food business.  This means she can earn more income and improve her daughters' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her hamburger business.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, obtuvo una buena cosecha de maíz, maicillo y ajonjolí, esto es por la buena inversión del crédito anterior, su situación económica ha mejorado permitiéndole cancelar sus cuotas a tiempo; su familia se desintegro,   actualmente vive con sus padres, pero aún sigue muy al pendiente de lo que sus hijos necesitan.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, para realizar la próxima siembra de sus cultivos. De esta manera seguirá teniendo los ingresos que tanto necesita para salir a delante.
texts.en:
Jaime had a good harvest of corn, sorghum and sesame due to a sound investment of his previous loan.  His economic situation has improved allowing him to pay off the loan on time.  His family has gone separate ways, however, so he currently lives with his parents.  But he still is very concerned about the needs of his children.

He is requesting a new loan to buy compost, pesticides, insesticides, herbicides and seeds for his next planting season.  This is so he will earn enough to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy compost, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy green beans, tomatoes, cabbage, radishes, grapes, apples, pineapples, maize, mangos, plums, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel  vive con su esposa y son padres de 4 hijos.  

Miguel hace aproximadamente unos siete años, instalo un tienda en su casa de productos de primera necesidad,  cada día lucha por tener un mejor servicio para los clientes y también tener unos mejores ingresos y asi contribuir con la comunidad y poder sacar mejores ganancias. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, galletas, aceite, condimentos, huevos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, papel higiénico, etc.  con esto tendrá más mercadería, mas variedad para que sus clientes no tengan que ir a otro lado a adquirirlos. 

Miguel pretende  que su negocio  este bien surtido y además sea una tienda grande donde los clientes tengan una buena atención y puedan encontrar lo que necesitan para su consumo , ya que algún día la tienda pueda llegar hacer  un vendedor por mayoreo y poder ser mas popular y obtener mejores ingreso que hoy en día.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and four children.  Approximately seven years ago he set up a store in his house to sell basic goods.  Every day he struggles to offer a better service to his customers and to earn more income so he can contribute to the community and earn more profit.

The loan he is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, cookies, oil, condiments, eggs, bread, sweets, beverages, detergents, toilet tissue, etc. in order to have more merchandise and a wider variety so his customers will not have to go elsewhere to get what they need.

Miguel wants to have a well-stocked business and a large store where clients receive good service and can find what they need.  At some point the store may even sell wholesale and be even more popular to earn more income than it does currently.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, cookies, oil, condiments, eggs, bread, sweets, beverages, detergents, toilet tissue, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his college tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Zulma Arely

texts.es:
Zulma de 43 años de edad,  es una señora que solamente estudio hasta 9 grado, debido que cuando ella estudiaba en la escuela solamente había hasta noveno grado y para  ir a un instituto tenía que hacer un largo recorrido y no había transporte y necesitaba mucho dinero y su familia no podía ayudarla,  entonces opto por quedarse en su casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar a su mamá. Es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y hacer viajes en un camión halando fruta y verdura a diferentes lugares, tiene 4 hijos una hija de 20 años que estudia en la universidad, dos varones de las edades de 18 y 16 que ambos estudian en el instituto y una hija de 14 años que estudia noveno grado en la escuela, en su casa viven seis personas sus cuatro hijos su esposo y ella.

Zulma se dedica al engorde de pollos, comenta que comenzó con 10 pollos y al ver que todo marchaba bien decidió comprar más y más hasta que obtuvo una granja la cual ha ido aumentando más hasta hacerla crecer actualmente tiene 600 pollos incluidos grandes y pequeños, la granja la tiene cerca de su casa a unos 100 metros no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que tiene que alimentar los pollos varias veces al día y en ocasiones vacunarlos aplicarles vitaminas, comenta que recibe el apoyo de su esposo e hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 200 pollos, vitaminas y alimento para que los pollos crezcan sanos, comenta que con la compra de los pollos lograra dar abasto a los pedidos que le hacen de diversos restaurantes y tiendas.

Zulma planea para su futuro poder tener su propia fábrica de pollos preparado en su propio local, poder emplear gente para que pueden ayudarle, también desea poder darle el estudio a sus hijos para que en un futuro puedan desempeñarse mejor y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zulma, 43, is a woman who has ninth grade education because that is as far as school went.  To go to high school she would have had to travel a far distance and transportation was not available.  She needed a considerable amount of money and her family could not help out, so she decided to stay at home and help her mother with the housework.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture and makes trips in his truck to sell fruit and vegetables in different places.  She has four children, a daughter who is 20 studying at the university, two boys, ages 18 and 16 who attend high school and a 14-year-old daughter in ninth grade.  Six people live at home, her four children, her husband and herself.

Zulma raises chickens and started out with ten.  Since it went well she decided to buy more and the farm has grown to over 600 chickens.  Her farm is near her home, about 100 meters away.  She does not have a fixed work schedule because she feeds the chickens several times a day and sometimes vaccinates them or gives them vitamins.  Her husband and children also help her.

The loan she is requesting is to buy 200 chickens, vitamins and animal feed so the chickens will grow healthy.  This way she will be able to fill the orders she has from different restaurants and stores.

Zulma has plans for the future to run her own chicken meat factory and hire people to help.  She also wants to give her children an education so they can be better off in the future and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy 200 chickens, vitamins and animal feed so they grow healthy.

loans.name: Raj

texts.en:
Raj feels very blessed by the help of Kiva lenders, and he thanks them a lot.
 
He repaid his last loan fully to all Kiva lenders, and with the profits he has been able to save for the future for himself and his mother.

Raj now wants more help for his rice production so that he can save more. He needs SRD 10,000 to purchase inputs like diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 19-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. She has been rearing and selling broiler chickens for the past one and a half years. She produces a batch of 25 birds every six weeks and sells them to the people in her community. Her family members assist her in the business.
 
Emilia is also very involved in her community as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. As a member of Cama, she assists the health professionals at her local clinic by weighing babies and recording their weight. She intends to use the Kiva loan to increase the number of broiler chicks, buy more vaccines and stock up on feed so that she can increase her production from 25 birds every six weeks to 25 broiler birds every week to meet the demand and increase her sales. The additional profits would enable her to pay school fees to further her education since she wants to train as a primary school teacher.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, feed and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sehlule

texts.en: Sehlule is a 20-year-old businesswoman residing in Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her husband. With assistance from her family members, she runs a shop selling grocery items to local community members. She has been running this business for the past year and is very proud of the progress she has made so far. Sehlule also has a passion to make her community a better place to live. With this in mind, she volunteers offering guidance and counseling sessions to secondary school students. Sehlule intends to make bulk purchases of cooking oil, sugar, soap, snacks and sanitary pads using the support from the Kiva loan. By purchasing in bulk, she will benefit from low prices and she will sell at favorable prices. This will result in high sales and profit volumes. With the additional profits, she hopes to own a big supermarket, create employment for the people in her community and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of grocery products

loans.name: Thabo

texts.en: Thabo is a young businesswoman, age 22, living in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a flea market stand where she sells shoes and clothing for men, women and children.  She is also a Cama member (Camfed’s alumni network) who volunteers along with other members assisting vulnerable children in their community with food and emotional support. With the requested loan from Kiva, she will purchase more stock to improve her sales volume. With the additional profits, she is planning to continue her education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 33-year-old married mother of three. She lives in Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her husband and children. She has been into the business of rearing broiler chicks and selling them to the people of her community. Violet produces a batch of 100 chickens every six weeks to support herself financially. To give back to her community, she also volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school, taking students through the sessions about personal well-being. With the requested loan from Kiva, Violet intends to purchase more feed, chicks and vaccines so that she can be in a position to produce more than one batch of 100 birds in six weeks. This would enable her to enjoy more sales and profits. With the additional profits, Violet intends to purchase a plot of land to rear broiler chicks on a large scale in order to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, feed and vaccines

loans.name: Sabbella

texts.en: Sabella is an 18-year-old entrepreneur living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been running a stand at the local flea market for the past six months with assistance from her family. When she is not working, Sabella volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school in her community where she mentors students on life skills and well-being. Sabella intends to purchase high quality clothing in bulk with the support from her Kiva loan. This will enable her to increase her stock and hopefully lead to an increase in profits. With the additional profits, Sabella hopes to own a botique and  create employment for the people in community.

loans.use: to purchase high quality clothing in bulk

loans.name: Ruvimbo

texts.en: Ruvimbo is a 19-year-old married woman with one child. She lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her family where she has been rearing and selling broiler chickens for the past six months with assistance from her family. Ruvimbo produces batches of 50 birds every six weeks. Besides being a businesswoman, Ruvimbo is a Cama (Camfed’s alumnae netowrk) member who volunteers in her spare time assisting the health personnel at her local clinic with different duties, including cleaning the premises and preparing the babies for weighing. With the requested loan from Kiva, Ruvimbo intends to produce batches of 50 broilers twice a month to meet the customers' demands and increase her sales and profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to own a butchery and create employment for the people in community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Forgiveness

texts.en: Forgiveness is 18 years old. She is single and lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. She has been selling clothes and shoes in her community market for one year. She volunteers in her area by making follow-up visits to school dropouts and referring them to programs that provide assistance in getting them back to school.  With the requested loan from Kiva, Forgiveness is planning to purchase clothes from wholesalers at reduced costs. This will allow her to sell them at more favorable prices and increase her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from wholesalers at reduced costs

loans.name: Oomnath

texts.en:
Oomnath is very thankful to all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production.

With the profits from last season, Oomnath was able to save for the education of his children, but that is not enough for the coming period. So he has to save more. 

For that reason, he has to expand his rice productions and asks Kiva lenders for another loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nothando

texts.en: Nothando is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been running a flea market stand selling clothing for the past one year with assistance from her family members. When she is not working in her flea market, Nothando is assisting girls at her local secondary school with guidance and counseling lessons. Nothando intends to purchase high quality clothing to become competitive in the business with the support from a Kiva loan. This will boost her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, she hopes to own a botique and create employment for the people in community. This will also enable her to continue with her education and enroll in nursing school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as chains, watches, rings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Creator

texts.en:
Creator is a 19-year-old mother of one living with her parents in the Umguza District in Zimbabwe. Creator has been selling clothes at a flea market for over a year, while still volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaching life skills courses in local schools. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, Creator hopes to purchase more clothing to sell. She plans to use her additional proceeds to register for her next level of exams and further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en:
Primrose is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe where she lives with her parents and siblings. Primrose sells clothing at a flea market and has been doing this business for one year now. 

In her spare time, she is also a Learner Guide at the nearby secondary school in her community where she assists students with their studies.  With the support from a Kiva loan, Primrose will purchase clothing in bulk. This will enable her to enjoy higher sales and increased profits. She is planning to use the additional profits to pay the school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Bridgety

texts.en: Bridgety is a 25-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Kwekwe district in Zimbabwe with her husband and one child. She has been selling clothes  for the past six months and her family members assist her in the business since she cannot afford to employ anyone to assist her at the moment. Bridgety also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools where she teaches life skills. With the requested loan from Kiva, Bridgety intends to purchase fashionable clothes from wholesalers in bulk in order to survive among her competitors. This would help to boost her sales and profits. With the increased profits, she wants to further her education in business management.

loans.use: to purchase fashionable clothes from wholesalers in bulk in order to survive among her competitors.

loans.name: Mahendre

texts.en:
Mahendre is feeling blessed with the help of Kiva lenders. He thanks them a lot. Mahendre is a very hardworking and dedicated farmer. With the profits of his rice cultivation of last season, he could save for his marriage.

Mahendre wants now to save for the future of his family. That’s why he has expanded his rice production. For the purchase of diesel, fertilizers and pesticides, he asks Kiva lenders for another loan of 10,000 SRD.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Nomusa

texts.en:
Nomusa is a 24-year-old businesswoman.  She lives in the Umzingwane District of Zimbabwe and has been successfully selling clothing, shoes and blankets at a local flea market. She is also a Learner Guide at the local school teaching students life skills.

Using the loan from Kiva, Nomusa intends to purchase more clothing, shoes and blankets in bulk so that her sales will increase. With increased profits, she would like to pay school fees for her siblings and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes and foam rubber mattresses for the past one year with assistance from her family. She also volunteers assisting girls with guidance and counseling at the local secondary school in her community. 

With the Kiva loan, Joyce will purchase additional clothes and mattresses in bulk at a lower price from wholesalers. This will enable her business to grow and generate increased profits. With additional profits, Joyce hopes to own a clothing store, create employment for the people in her community, as well as help meet her siblings’ financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes and mattresses in bulk

loans.name: Sithokozile

texts.en:
Sithokozile is a 31-year-old entrepreneur residing in Zimbabwe’s Kwekwe District with her husband and three children.

In 2013, she realized she needed to start an income generating project so as to provide for her family. With this motivation in mind, Sithokozile ventured into the selling of clothes at a local flea market. She is very happy that she started the business because it has given her the income she needs to provide for her family’s basic needs.

In her spare time, and to give back to the community, Sithokozile volunteers helping orphans by providing them with food from her field. This gives them the nutrition they need to focus in school and do well in the community.
