loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, su negocio cuenta con 14 años de estar funcionando y nace por la necesidad de ofrecer a su familia una vida más confortable. Blanca vive con su esposo y dos hijos, como una familia unida todos trabajan y aportan en los gastos de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de ejotes, manzanas, piñas, melones, güisquiles, pipianes, papayas, zanahorias, rábanos, uvas, tomates, repollos, etc., con lo que podrá surtir de mercadería fresca su negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar la situación familiar y cumplir con los pagos de su deuda adquirida.
Su aspiración es tener los recursos económicos con los que pueda comprarse una propiedad y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Blanca works selling fruits and vegetables. She works every day without a set schedule, and her business has been functioning for 14 years, born of the need to offer her family a more comfortable life. Blanca lives with her husband and two children; as a close family, everyone works and supports the household expenses.  

She will invest in the purchase of green beans, apples, pineapple, melon, chayote, pipianes, papayas, carrots, radishes, grapes, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. with which she will be able to stock the fresh merchandise of her business.  She hopes to attract new customers, improve the family situation, and make the payments on her debt.

Her aspiration is to have the economic resources so that she can purchase some land and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase green beans, apples, pineapple, melon, chayote, pipianes, papayas, carrots, radishes, grapes, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia is 59 years old, married, and a resident of Poblacion, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through her sari-sari store. She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now she is applying a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional stocks. Constancia deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alhaji Ishaq A.

texts.en:
Alhaji Ishaq A. is a 30-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Ishaq A. is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alhaji Ishaq A. can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize -- more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alhaji Ishaq A. is ambitious and is aiming to reap 120 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Alhaji Ishaq A. said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home,” and in five years, he wants to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” 

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his yield and  income.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 60 years old and a resident of Olingan,Dipolog City. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC almost four years. Her husband is a fisherman. They have one daughter who is already married. Starting with capital of PHP 5,000 she opened a sari-sari store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum MPC. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the Coop.  Now she is applying for PHP 20,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future she wants to own a mini-mart.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Delfer

texts.es:
Delfer tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia de de material rustico junto a su esposa y 02 hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian en la escuela del mismo centro poblado Cedro del Pasto, una zona rural del distrito de Colasay, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, cereales entre otros su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, también da pensión a profesores que trabajan en su distrito, preparando por ella misma los alimentos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Delfer, age 48, lives in his own house, which is made of basic materials.  He lives with his wife and his two minor children.  The children go to school in the central village of Cedro del Pasto.  It is a rural area in the Colasay district.  Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He sells basic needs products like rice, cooking oil, and grains, among other things.  His business is located at his house.  He also provides boarding house service to teachers who work in his district.  His wife prepares their food herself.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles to buy a variety of products to stock his business.  This way he will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 33-year-old woman, with three children. She runs a small plantation and pancake business in which she sells to the members of her community and she has been doing this for more than three years now. 

She plans to use this money to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, and a mist blower for her plantation, cooking oil, baking powder, sugar, and flour for her pancake business, and to pay school fees for children's education. 

With the profits Maria has been earning from her business, she has managed to improve the quality of life of her family. She hopes to save some profit, so that she may be able to expand her plantation business.

loans.use: to purchase items for her plantation, cooking items for her pancake business, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is from Balolang, Larena, Siquijor. She is 64 years old and married with three adult children. In 2013, Marcela applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing, and repays her obligations in a timely manner. Now, Marcela is asking for financial assistance of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional sacks of feed. Through this, she hopes to increase he income, and to expand her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es: Hilario es habitante de la comunidad la flor  acá el nació y creció con su familia , estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria en la escuela de la comunidad , luego se dedico  ayudarle a trabajar  a su padre en los labores agrícolas así dice que el aprendió  a trabajar la tierra y a tener amor por ella.  a la edad de 25 años dice se caso de ese matrimonio a procreado  6 hijos  la mayoría de ellos ya están grandes y tienen hasta su propia familia. el se dedica a cultivar unas parcelas de tierra que tiene de las cosechas el puede sacar a su familia adelante y proveerles el pan de cada día. por las noches usan candiles para alumbrase ya que en la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica  el desea aplicar a crédito para así comprar un sistema solar y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres amado su familia.
texts.en: Hilario lives in the “La Flor” community where he was born and raised with his family. He studied until third grade in the community school. Then he dedicated himself to helping his father with the farm work.  In this way, he says that he learned to work the land and to have love for it.  At the age of 25, he got married and has six children from this marriage. Most of them are already grown, and even have their own families.  Hilario is engaged in cultivating plots of land that he has, and from the harvests, he is able to get his family ahead and provide them with the daily bread.  At night, they use candlelight because there is no electricity in the community.  He wishes to apply for a loan to purchase a solar energy system and improve the quality of living for his family of loved ones

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system.

loans.name: San Patricio

texts.es:
San Patricio tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto con sus hijos en el Caserío de Piquijaca, una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de lima, tiene una parcela cercana a su domicilio, es un emprendedor dado que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, el comercio lo realiza para clientes que llevan la fruta a la ciudad de Chiclayo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
San Patricio is 31 years old and lives with his children in the small village of Piquijaca, in a rural area of San Felipe District, Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru. The people of this area work in agriculture, trade and raising cattle.

San Patricio works in agriculture, growing limes on a plot of land near his home. He is an entrepreneur and puts a lot of effort into his work. He sells his limes to customers who transport them to the city of Chiclayo. He is requesting this loan of 4,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy manure to maintain his lime trees. He hopes to improve his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure to maintain his lime trees.

loans.name: Rosy Ynes

texts.es:
Rosy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo abrir un Salón de Belleza con el cual trabaja desde hace algún tiempo, y con los ingresos obtenidos ayuda a su familia. Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y siempre trabaja con gran entusiasmo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Rosy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para implementar su negocio y de esta manera pueda obtener mayores ingresos para más adelante poder abrir un Salón mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Rosy is an enterprising young woman, she is 21 years old, single, and lives in Ica with her family.

With much effort and dedication, she could open a beauty salon where she has worked for some time, and with the income she earned, help her family.  She is a person with a strong desire to improve herself and always works with a lot of enthusiasm in order to get her family ahead.

Rosy is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase materials to stock her business and in this way get more income to be able to, in the future, open a much larger salon.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ali Dangwarta

texts.en:
Ali Dangwarta is a maize farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Ali Dangwarta, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ali Dangwarta can earn up to $2,000/ha this season from growing maize -- more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ali Dangwarta is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ali Dangwarta said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland,” and ultimately, he wants to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” 

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his yield and income.

loans.name: Mario Martin

texts.es:
Mario es un joven emprendedor, tiene  23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Nazca con su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 3 años trabaja como Operario de construcción y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, honesto y muy dedicado a su labor.
Mario está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un vehículo para poder transportarse de su casa a su trabajo y ahorrar el dinero de sus pasajes. Con esto seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil"
texts.en: Mario is a young, 23 year old entrepreneur with a strong desire to succeed.  His is single and lives in Nazca with his family.  He has been a construction worker for over three years, and it is going very well because he is very hard working, responsible, honest, and very dedicated to his work.  Mario is grateful for the Kiva loans because with the help they have provided, he will be able to purchase a vehicle to transport himself between home and work, and save money on tickets.  With this, he will continue striving further and be able to fulfill his great dream, “to study for a degree in civil engineering”.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 54-year-old married woman with 12 children. She runs a plantation, and her customers are the members of her community as well as the traveling public. Because she wants to expand her business, she has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use her loan to purchase a mist blower and chemicals, bushknives, spades and shovels, a crowbar, and a blade sharpener for her business. Amelia hopes to earn a good profit from her business, which she plans to save so that she can help with her family's financial obligations and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower and chemicals, bushknives, spades and shovels, a crowbar, and a blade sharpener.

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en: Palepa is a 52-year-old widow with seven children. Last month she started a business baking pancakes and selling them to the members of her community. She took this initiative in order to help out with her family's financial obligations instead of depending solely on her children. To help her get her business started, she has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, she plans to purchase cooking oil, sacks of flour, a cooking stove, a large frying pan, sugar, baking powder, an oil drainer, and tongs for her business. Palepa hopes to save most of her profit so that she can help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sacks of flour, a cooking stove, a large frying pan, sugar, baking powder, an oil drainer, and tongs for her baking business.

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en: Gretchen is 26 years old, single, and a resident of Cangomantong, Lazi. She earns a living through raising pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for one year and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional sacks of feed and piglets. Gretchen deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Nuevo Futuro Group

texts.es:
MARIANO. Con 51 años de edad vive con su esposa y 2 de sus 4 hijos. Los dos hijos mayores tienen  su propia familia y viven en otras ciudades  su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar y cultiva cacao en una pequeña finca. 
Agradece mucho la responsabilidad de sus compañeros en el proceso de crédito y eleva sus agradecimientos a Dios por la oportunidad que brinda a través de FODEMI de mejorar la calidad de vida de su comunidad con pequeños créditos.
El crédito anterior me sirvió mucho ya que pude tramitar los documentos de identidad de mis hijos y adquirir mercadería (mariscos) para mejorar las ventas. Dice Mariano.
Siempre me he dedicado al negocio de la pesca y con el presente crédito, comprare una red nueva para mejorar los resultados de la pesca diaria y poder ofrecer a la comunidad mejores productos.
El producto de su trabajo, lo comercializa en Esmeraldas, Borbón y San Lorenzo. Los últimos 3 meses no se ha logrado una buena producción en la pesca y muchos de los clientes han desaparecido de las ciudades donde se les entregaba el marisco.
Pese a los peligros de robo de embarcaciones y motores. Espera en 3 años haber crecido en clientes y mejorar sus resultados en la pesca diaria.

Felicita el proceso de crédito de esta organización, ya que es una buena ayuda al artesano. No se pide garantías para estos créditos y no piden muchos requisitos como en los bancos.
Es una buena oportunidad para los pequeños empresarios.
texts.en:
Mariano is 51 years old and lives with his wife and 2 of his 4 children. The older two children have their own families and live in other cities. His wife takes care of the household chores and plants cocoa in a small farm.

He is very grateful for his partners' responsibility in the loan process and lifts his thanks to God for the opportunity that He offers through FODEMI to improve the quality of live in his community with small loans.

"The previous loan served me well since I could complete the process of getting identity documents for my children and acquire merchandise (shellfish) to improve sales," says Mariano. "I have always worked in fishing and with the current loan, I will purchase a new net to improve the daily results from fishing and be able to offer better products to the community."

He sells the product of his work in Esmeraldas, Borbón and San Lorenzo. For the past 3 months, he has not been able to have a good result of his fishing and many of his customers have left to the cities where they get their shellfish, due to the dangers of theft of boats and motors.  He hopes in three years to have grown in his customer base and improve the daily results from his fishing.

He is grateful for the loan process of this organization, since it is a good help to the artisan. They don't ask for guarantees for these loans and don't have as many requirements as banks do.

This is a good opportunity for the small businesspeople.

loans.use: to purchase a new net to improve the daily results from fishing and to be able to offer the community better products

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es:
Juan Rodolfo tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales menores, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, trasladado a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para tornear motor y mantenimiento del mismo que le permitirá seguir brindando este servicio de una manera segura.
texts.en:
Juan Rodolfo is 24 years old, and lives with his parents in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a warm climate whose population works in agriculture, business, and raising small animals, located in the Morropon province, part of the Piura region, on the north coast of Perú.

He works offering a public transportation service in his motorcycle taxi, transporting people to nearby zones from his district.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles para tune his motor and maintain it, which will permit him to continue offering this service in a safe way.

loans.use: to tune the motor and maintain the vehicle.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita, 54 years old, is married and lives in Cangomantong, Lazi, Siquijor. She has 3 children who are of school-age.

From her desire to help the family, Janita has engaged in raising hogs, starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. She has operated for 2 years already. Now she is planning to borrow 5,000 PHP from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member this year. She wants to have a pig cage to display her pigs and piglets. 

Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Ralph Vincent

texts.en: Ralph Vincent is 20 years old and lives in Tubod, San Juan, Siquijor. In order to help the family, he sells a variety of products from Tupperware and Personal Collection. He became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. Ralph Vincent wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 12,000 PHP to purchase more goods for his buy and sell business because selling Tupperware is not sufficient for his daily needs. He also plans to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase additional Tupperware for his direct-selling.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, ha logrado una mayor productividad de maíz con lo que abasteció su hogar y a sus clientes en época de verano, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, brinda estudio a sus hijos y sus ingresos se mantienen estables para subsistir, esto es posible por la inversión del préstamo anterior.
 Nuevamente requiere capital para comprar 5 qq de abono, con lo que garantiza el buen desarrollo de la cosecha de maíz, espera tener nuevamente los efectos positivos del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Ernesto has had a larger harvest of corn, with which he stocked his home and his customers in the summer season. His family circumstance has improved, offering schooling to his children and his income has been stable for subsistence.  This has been possible with the investment of his previous loan.

Again, he needs a loan to purchase 5 quintals (500 pounds) of fertilizer, with which will guarantee a good development of his corn crop. He hopes to again

loans.use: 5 quintals (500 pounds) of fertilizer

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en El Caserío de Puquijaca, una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de lima, también se dedica al cultivo de café y plátanos en una pequeña parcela que esta ubicad cerca a su vivienda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos que le permita tener en buen mantenimiento sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 56 years old, and lives with his children in El Caserío de Puquijaca, a rural area of the San Felipe district, a community with a warm climate whose population works in agriculture, business, and animal husbandry, located in the Jaén province which is part of the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. 

He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of limes.  He also grows coffee and bananas on a small parcel of land that is located near his home. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer which will allow him to maintain his crops well and in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara, está preparando todo lo necesario para llevar a cabo la próxima siembra de maíz y pipián, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pagar arrendamiento del terreno. Mantendrá su negocio funcionando y generando ingresos importantes para subsistir junto a su familia.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha logrado una mejor cosecha, ha cubierto las demandas del mercado, tiene nuevos clientes, su familia se mantiene y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
Xiomara is getting everything ready to sow the next crop of corn and squash. She is asking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide and also to pay the rental of the piece of land. This will keep her business working and generating important income for the sustenance of the family.
With the previous loan, Xiomara was able to get better crops and meet the demands of the market. She made new customers, provided for her family and paid back her debt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide and to pay the rent of the land.

loans.name: Maryuri Del Socorro

texts.es: Maryuri es originaria  de la comunidad el mojado  dice que gracias al apoyo brindado de sus padres ella estudio hasta tercer año de secundaria   después dejo los estudios porque decidió casarse  hoy es madre de 2 hijas las que dice son la razón de su vida  por eso ella y su esposo se esfuerzan para que sus hijas estudien y no les falte el pan de cada día, se dedican ambos a  cultivar la tierra  de esta manera obtienen ingresos para los gastos de la familia. En esta comunidad no hay energía eléctrica por eso quiere aplicar a un préstamo para comprar  un sistema solar  para su hogar este ayudaría mucho para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que el vivir a oscuras es bien triste.
texts.en:
Maryuri is a native of the community of El Mojado.  She said she studied up to the third year of secondary school thanks to her parents.  Then she left school because she decided to get married.  Now she's the mother of two daughters, who she said are her reason in life.  She and her husband work hard so their daughters can go to school and and never lack their daily bread.  Both Maryuri and her husband work in farming to earn income for the family expenses.

There's no electricity in this community, so Maryuri wants to apply for a loan to buy a solar energy system for her home.

This would help her a lot to improve her family's quality of life, because living in the dark is very sad.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Issaka

texts.en:
Issaka is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in traditional African carvings and masks. He would like to invest in his business by purchasing raw materials such as calabash, wood boards, charcoal, glue, and metal plates in bulk.

Issaka has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:
"I work with wood, aluminum, copper, calabash, and aluminum. I feel my works are very unique and beautiful, and this has not changed. My dream is to become known as an artist. I like to keep busy and find motivation in educating others about art. In fact, I have taught the craft to others. Although my work has been exhibited in hotels and is prized by my clients, my greatest challenges in life have been financial, and also promoting my art. I am very happy for your support through your microcredit. Thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Issaka's traditional African carvings and masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7133

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk, such as calabash, wood boards, charcoal, glue, and metal plates.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in African masks and drums. He would like to invest in his business by purchasing raw materials, including wood and polish.

Ralph has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I have always been interested in art. After finishing school, I worked as a weaver in a textile company from 1973 to 1995, when the company had to lay off some of its workers. I then decided to learn a trade of my own. I was so determined to make it, it took me just a few months to learn wood carving and I discovered a surprising natural ability.

I would like to thank you for your support. This microcredit will go a long way towards helping me continue to craft my products."

Use the link below to view Ralph's African masks and drums on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/2090

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including wood and polish.

loans.name: Jeysson Alberto

texts.es:
En Ecuador en la Provincia de Pichincha el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos es un lugar muy hermoso de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, el mismo es conocido como uno de los cantones de mayor producción de ganado vacuno y ganado porcino, en este Cantón en el recinto San Bernabé vive el Sr Jeysson un hombre luchador de 31 años, mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la misma tienen 2 hijos el mayor de 11 años y el ultimo de 7 años, ellos estudian en la escuela del sector la esposa trabaja de forma independiente en el bar de la escuela donde estudian los hijos. 
Ellos se dedican a la producción de cerdos y ganado de leche aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papas, ya que nació y creció en una finca ganadera entre sus dos actividades trabaja un promedio de 10 horas por día. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de alimentos para los cerdos y en adecuaciones de las chancheras y sus instalaciones, con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar e incrementar su producción y sus ingresos económicos 
El señor Jeyson agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por en apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos in the province of Pichincha in Ecuador is a very beautiful place with a warm, humid climate, and full of friendly, hardworking people. It is also known for being a region with one of the highest production of cattle and pigs. Jeysson lives in the San Bernabé area of the Canton. He is a hardworking, 31 year-old man who is in a strong relationship with his wife, with whom he has two children who are 11 and 7 years old. The children study in the local school, and his wife works in the café of their children’s school.

They make a living raising pigs and producing milk, which Jeysson has done alongside his parents since childhood, having been born and raised on a cattle farm. Between the two activities, he works an average of 10 hours a day.

He is requesting this loan to invest in his business by buying pig feed and maintaining the butchering site and the facilities. With this investment, he hopes to increase his production and income. Jeysson is grateful for the Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities they provide.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and maintain the butcheries.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good-standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

Carmelita is requesting a loan, in the amount of PHP 12,000. This loan is intended to purchase an additional sack of feed and piglets.

Carmelita  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sack of feed and piglets.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is from Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is 27 years old and single with one child. 

In 2012, Jennylyn applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Now, Jennylyn is asking for financial assistance of PHP 13,500 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, oil and yeast for her food vending business. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients such as flour, oil and yeast.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella, age 61, is happy tending her little store. She is married with two children. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Estrella  keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Estrella believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Estrella has reached her 1 year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of "member in good standing". She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there, afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 37-year-old married woman with no children. She operates a lawn mowing business with her husband and they have been doing this for more than two years now. She plans to use this loan to purchase a new lawn mower, oil, lawn mowing strings, petrol, and tool box for her lawn mowing business. Elisapeta has been able to meet some of her family's financial obligations with the profits that she has been earning from her business. She hopes to expand her business with the profits and hopes to save so that she would be able to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase a new lawn mower, oil, lawn mowing strings, petrol, and tool box

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna earns a living through an internet cafe. She is 30 years old, married and lives in Siquijor. She is now well-known for the nice quality of services she offers.  She has already purchased some new computer sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about 10,000 PHP per month.  

Verna is seeking a 50,000 PHP loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase equipment for her internet cafe. This is a regular loan and would be repaid in several months. In her 2 previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Verna is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To buy additional computers and equipment for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Edica

texts.en:
Edica is from Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor (Philippines). She is 48 years old and is married with adult and school-aged children.

In 2013, Edica became a member of PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits, she did not hesitate to join. She maintains the status of a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Edica has requested financial assistance of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional piglets and feed. Through this loan, she hopes to expand her business and increase her income. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education provided by the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

Emilyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She intends to use this loan to purchase additional liters of fuel for retail. Emilyn dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fuel.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a su pasajeros a caseríos cercanos a su comunidad, cuenta con clientela por el buen servicio que brinda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas para sembrar y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and child in the district of Zaña, a community which works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the province of Chiclayo which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

He works providing a public transportation service in his own motorcycle taxi, carrying passengers to villages near his community. He has customers due to the good service he offers.  He asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,5000 nuevos soles to purchase seeds to plant and in this way generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant.

loans.name: Elefina

texts.es:
Elefina tiene 55 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde la población es amable y se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral desde hace 8 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de gallinas, cerdos y patos para incrementar la crianza de los mismo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elefina is 55 years old, and lives with her children in the Oyotún district, a rural area, whose population is friendly and works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the Chiclayo province which is part of the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.

She has worked purchasing and selling farm animals for the past 8 years. Her business is located in her home, and she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,5000 nuevos soles to purchase chickens, pigs and ducks to expand the raising of the same, and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, ducks and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Wendranigyande Group

texts.fr:
FATIMATA  est responsable du groupe WENDRANIGYANDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques, du savon et des tubes de pommades et de poudres depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Mme veut s’acheter 02douzaines de plats , 03douzaines de catégories de pommade.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et aider son mari dans les charges de la maison.
texts.en:
Fatimata is responsible for the Wendranigyande group. She is doing well, and she is the married mother of four children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is six years old. All four go to school.
 
For the past eleven years she has been selling plastic containers, soap, tubes of ointments and powders. She resupplies at her local market. 

She intends to buy two dozen containers, and three dozen ointments of different kinds.

She would like to reinvest her profits into her business, and aims to expand her business and help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy two dozen containers, three dozen ointments of different kinds

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is a 41-year-old, married resident of Bolot, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor (Philippines). She earns a living as a food vendor.

Gena has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and enjoys the membership privileges of the Cooperative. She is now applying for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, flour, cassava, and butter for her snack business.

Gena deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, flour, cassava, and butter for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est aussi créé en 2011 et regroupe en leur sein des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Fatou en position debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Elle est à son deuxiéme prêt avec notre institution,elle compte acheter avec son crédit des semences d'arachide pour 30000f et des semences de mil pour 25000f afin de bien préparer la campagne hivernale.

Son objectif est d'assurer les frais de santé de ses enfants,augmenter son épargne et contribuer dans le budget familial.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2011 and includes members living in the same village whose main activity is agriculture. 

Fatou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is the person responsible for the group. She is married and the mother of seven children including four boys. 

She is on her second loan with our institution, and intends to use this loan to buy groundnut seeds for 30,000 francs and millet seeds for 25,000 francs, in preparation for the winter campaign. 

Her aim is to cover her children's healthcare costs, increase her savings and contribute towards the family budget.

loans.use: buy a stockpile of mil and groundnut seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, perfume, and cream to stock her business.

loans.name: Edie

texts.en: Edie has mastered his business of "puso" (hanging rice). "Puso" is sold wrapped in coconut leaves. This is popular in the rural area of Lopez Jaena. Start-up capital for Edie's business came from Paglaum. He is able to handle his business skillfully and he would like to increase his production. To achieve this, Edie reached out to PMPC for another loan to purchase more kilos of rice for making his "puso." Edie wishes to sustain his business and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of rice for making "puso" (hanging rice).

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 56, is married and lives in Lopez Jaena. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items.

Lydia's business helps her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children.

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already received previous loans to purchase additional stock of products and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ernesto Eliseo

texts.es:
Ernesto, es casado, junto a su esposa comparten la felicidad y responsabilidad de ver crecer a su hijo de 3 años de edad, todos viven juntos; se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de cerdos, el negocio lo realiza desde hace 4 años, es un oficio que su padre le enseño, trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
El capital le será de mucha ayuda para comprar cerdos, fertilizantes, semilla, abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas y herbicidas, fortalecerá su negocio, preparara el terreno para sembrar maíz y evitara la amenaza de plagas. Espera ir ampliando su negocio poco a apoco para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
Su anhelo es tener un negocio con mayor rentabilidad para que sea autosuficiente y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married and, with his wife, shares the joy and responsibility of seeing his 3-year-old child grow; they all live together. He works growing basic grains and raising pigs, a business that he has done for the past four years. It is work his father taught him. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

The loan will be a great help to purchase pigs, fertilizer, seeds, manure, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides. He will strengthen his business, prepare the land to plant corn, and avoid the threat of pests.  He hopes to continue growing his business little by little to have better economic stability.

His desire is to have a business with better profitability to be self-sufficient and improve his family's life style.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, fertilizer, seeds, manure, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche, who is 38 years old, lives in Usocan Plaridel. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. She began with selling only a few items.

Roche joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for another loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 36 years old and is from Lopez Jaena. She signed up for her membership with PMPC to obtain the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (small grocery) store business.

Erlyn is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Marygen

texts.en:
Marygen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets too tired to support her family. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. 

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she would like to add heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her chance to have a business 10 years ago. 

PMPC came to Lilia as a rescue, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she applied for another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.

Lilia perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family now that she has to raise her children alone.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina operates a general store. She previously accessed a loan of 51,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. Gina also sells pork, fish, vegetables, and fruits for additional income. 

Gina would now like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Gina's profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gina dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.



*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel and a door to cement the floor of the house and have better security.

loans.name: Las Flores  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Flores formado por 11 socias quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza arquitectónica, cultural y natural que cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y muy cordial. Todas las socias luchan día a día para sacar a sus familias en adelante, los créditos les permiten inyectar un poco de capital para ir creciendo en sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Gladys, tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y aun no tiene hijos, su esposo labora como mecánico, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
Doña Gladys se dedica al comercio, vende ropa desde hace cuatro años, su mercadería compra en otras ciudades y también vende ropa por catalogo, vende recorriendo la ciudad todos los días sin un horario figo. Su crédito va a invertir en la compra ropa. Su meta es  tener un almacén para vender su mercadería.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Flores" is formed by 11 members who live in the city of Cuenca. This city has beautiful architecture, culture and nature which captivates locals and foreigners. The city has a rich and varied gastronomy and their people are kind and cordial.
The members of the communal bank strive every day to provide for their families and loans allow them to inject some capital into their businesses to help them grow. One of the members in this group is Gladys. She is 21 years old, married and has no children. Her husband works as a mechanic. They don't own a house and live in the house of a relative. Gladys works selling clothes and has done this for four years. She buys merchandise in other cities and sells it as a street vendor every day, without a fixed schedule. She also sells via catalog order. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of clothes. Her goal is to have a store in which to sell her merchandise.
The inset picture is from a member who could not be present for the group picture.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marie Therese's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 01 Juin 2007, et vient d’entamer son quatorzième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

Madame Marie (assise à  droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une dame tés engagée dans les activités du banc villageois, elle reste une femme exemplaire et soucieuse du devenir de sa famille. Elle est mariée, mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est propriétaire d’un frigo où  elle vend des jus à bas de produits locaux et crème glacée pour enfant. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années. 

Avec son crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter 03 sacs de sucre, 04 sacs de pain de singe, 04 sacs d’oseille sec et divers produits de consommation.

 Avec les bénéfices,  elle compte assurer la prise en charge alimentaire, sanitaire et vestimentaire pour ces enfants d’une part et d’autre part renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 1, 2007, and it is entering its 14th  cycle. Even though they struggle to sustain income-generating activities in this area, the group members are highly determined and show a lot of courage. They live in the same village and they share a bond of solidarity. Their main business activity is small trade, along with rain-fed farming. 

Mrs. Marie (sitting on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower for this group. She is deeply involved in the activities of the Banc Villageois. She is a role model, and very devoted to her family’s well-being. She is married with six children, four girls and two boys. 

Mrs. Marie owns a refrigerator to sell ice cream to children and juices made from local products. She has been practicing this activity for many years and has built a solid experience.  

She will use her loan to buy three sacks of sugar, four sacks of monkey bread (baobab fruit), four sacks of dried sorrel and various other food items. 

She plans to use part of her profits to provide for her children’s needs in terms of food, healthcare and clothing, and the remainder to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of sugar, four sacks of monkey bread (baobab fruit), four sacks of dried sorrel and various other food items.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is driven by passion to sell. At the age of 61, married, from Plaridel, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. 

Lydia never gets tired of tending her store. She is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations, without records of default. 

Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, Lydia dreams of sustaining her store, to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Taguig City, Philippines. She is 52 years old and has children who are currently in school. Ronald, her husband, is a retired officer. Yolanda manages a variety store business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. She also find ways to improve her income. She offers house rental and operates a jeepney (small bus) unit.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

Yolanda is taking out a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy grocery items that are needed in her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other supplies that are necessary to increase her inventory. In the future, she wants for her children to finish their studies. She also hopes to be always healthy and fit for work.

Yolanda meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 42 years old, from Lopez Jaena. She is married and is engaged in managing a car, refrigeration, radiator repair shop, together with her husband, as the repairman. 

She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair shop business. 

Jean hopes to expand their radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials for her business.

loans.name: Guamboteñas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Guamboteñas está formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por la comunidad de Llacao en Cuenca, lugar que goza de hermosos paisajes, su arquitectura es  una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente se dedica la agricultura y crianza de animales. Todas las socias son personas amables que tienen un objetivo en común el cual es mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y sacar a sus familias adelante.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Sra. Zoila, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de un año y medio, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar,  la casa en la que viven es de sus padres. 
Doña Zoila es profesional en la rama de la costura ya que ha estudiado y también aprendió trabajando, ahora cuenta con su propio taller desde hace 2 años, realiza todo tipo de arreglos de prendas de vestir así como también confecciona, también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas de postura y a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de hilos, tijeras y telas. Su sueño es ser una gran modista.
texts.en:
The credit group Guamboteñas is formed of 8 female and 2 male members who live in the community of Llacao in Cuenca, a place that enjoys beautiful landscape, whose architecture is a mix of the old and new, and whose people work in agriculture and raising animals. All of the members are friendly people who have a common objective to improve the stability of their homes and get their families ahead.

One of the members of this group is Zoila, who is 24 years old, the single mother of a child who is one year and a half old, and who lives with her parents with whom she shares the household expenses. Her parents own the house they live in.

Zoila is a professional in the field of sewing since she has studied it and also learned while working. Now she has had her own workshop for the past two years, and does all sorts of adjustments on clothing, as well as as making clothing. She also works raising laying hens and in the agriculture that is for household consumption. The money from the loan is for the purchase of thread, scissors, and fabric.  Her dream is to be a great fashion designer.

loans.use: to purchase thread, scissors and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy Evella

texts.es:
Nancy Evelia tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Huaca El Toro, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales para engorde como cuyes, patos y gallinas para engorde y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy Evelia is 33 years old, in a civil union with two children in her care. She lives in her own home in the Huaca El Toro village, in a rural area of the Oyotun district, whose population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. 

She has worked raising and selling farm animals for the past 5 years. Her business is located in her home.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase animals for fattening such as guinea pigs, ducks, and hens to fatten them, and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals such as guinea pigs, hens and ducks to fatten.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
In 2012, Arnold learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. He tried his luck in doing a business, focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him  with the money he used as capital. 

He was loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help provide a big boost to his farming income. Arnold looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Zoila Teresita

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De  Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es jubilado, ella es Lic. En Ciencias De La Salud Natural.
Doña Zoila para salir adelante y con su actividad ayudar a solventar los gastos de hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales,  ella también realiza trabajos de terapias a personas que requieren de sus servicios y allí aprovecha para vender los productos ya los utiliza en sus sesiones de trabajo, sus productos son muy buenos y de gran ayuda para la salud, razón por lo cual tiene mucha clientela que siempre  les piden sus productos, trabaja todos los días en el momento que sus clientes la necesiten, ella está lista para ofrecer sus servicios y vender sus productos. Tienen más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan los créditos. Sus metas son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Desarrollo Femenino" credit group meets every 15 days in the Calderón parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its cuisine and vegetation. Most of its residents work in agriculture and commerce in general.

This is where Zoila lives. She is 68 years old, married, and has six grown children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is retired and she has a degree in Natural Health Sciences. In order to move forward and pay for household expenses, she started to sell natural products. She also provides therapy to people who need it, and they also benefit from the natural products that she also uses in her therapy sessions. Her products are very good and helpful for health, which is why many customers always order her products.

She works every day at whatever time her customers need her. She is always ready to offer her services and sell her products. She has been working in this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her. 

This loan will help her to purchase natural products. She has been a member of the credit group from the beginning and likes it because of the help that the loans provide. Her goal is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gladys Ufelia

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y vive en el Distrito de Imperial junto a su familia.
Es una persona muy luchadora, siempre ha trabajado para sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder ofrecerles una buena educación y un futuro mejor. Desde hace más de 6 años trabaja como vendedora de cerveza y gaseosas, le va muy bien porque es muy constante en su labor, responsable y entusiasta.
Gladys está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para suministrar el negocio y así obtener mayores ventas y ganancias. Con esto, y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ella seguirá trabajando para conseguir su sueño: "Tener su propia bodega".
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising woman. She is 56 years old, married and lives in the Imperial district of Peru with her family.

Gladys is a plucky woman and has always worked in order to help her children to prosper, and to offer them a good up-bringing and better future. For over six years, Gladys has worked selling fizzy drinks and beer. The business is going very well because Gladys is very persevering, responsible and enthusiastic in her work.

Gladys is grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business selling beers and fizzy drinks. She will then have higher sales and profits. Then, with a a lot of effort and dedication, Gladys will continue working in order to achieve her dream of having her own little grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business selling beers and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarías tiene 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y su menor hijo de 16 años de edad el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, así como de verduras, las ventas lo realiza en el mercado de abastos de su distrito, también se desempeña como operador de maquinaria pesada en la Municipalidad de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 54 years old and lives in a house built with rustic materials that he owns. Zacarías lives with his partner and youngest son, who is 16 years old and currently attending the local state high school in the Pucara district. Located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region is Peru's northern coast, Pucara has a warm climate, and the people make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Zacarías makes a living selling groceries such as vegetables. He makes his sales at the local makret. Zacarías also works operating heavy machinery for the local municipality.

Zacarías has applied for a loan from of 3000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy a variety of products to sell to customers and generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sỹ

texts.en: Mr. Sy (on behalf of his wife Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hoe ) is 34 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children. He works hard to support his family. He has been working in the fish business for more than 10 years. With this loan, he can build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of his family‘s member

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her famiily

loans.name: Manuel Cristobal

texts.es:
Manuel Cristóbal tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Manuel Cristóbal is 63 years old, married, and lives in Oyotún district, a community that works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú.

He has worked raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chicks, and guinea pigs for a number of years. His business is located in the rear of his home. He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals and in this way offer them for a better price.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 16 y 11 años, uno de los mayores estudia en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico industrial.
Doña Mercedes como buena esposa realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico donde realizan diversos trabajos como construcción de carrocerías para todo tipo de carros especialmente de autobuses,  para realizar estos trabajos ellos tiene que contratar dos o tres operarios. Ella también prepara alimentos los cuales entrega en una guardería de la localidad por lo cual cobra mensualmente por este servicio. Su esposo lleva más de 24 años dedicado a esta actividad. 
Este crédito es para comprar pintura, hierro y otros materiales necesarios para realizar el trabajo de su marido. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
In the Calderón province of the city of Portoviejo, the "Desarrollo Femenino" loan group meets every fortnight. Calderón is known for its delicious food and wide variety of vegetation. Here most people make a living in farming and trade.

And it is here that 46-year-old Mercedes lives. She is married and, with her husband, has three children, aged 19, 16 and 11 years old respectively. Two of Mercedes' children are still in school; her husband is an industrial mechanic.

Like any good wife, Mercedes is taking out this loan in order to help her husband, who has a mechanic's workshop where he carries out various jobs, such as bodywork for all types of vehicles, but particularly buses. In order to do this work, Mercedes' husband has two or three employees at any time, and has been doing this work for 24 years. Mercedes also works, preparing food for a local nursery. She is paid for this monthly.

This loan will be used to buy paint, iron and other necessary materials for Mercedes' husband to do his work. Mercedes has been with the loan group for ten years and likes it because the loans help her to prosper. Mercedes dream is to continue to do better.

loans.use: to buy paint, iron and other materials.

loans.name: Flormira

texts.es:
Flormira tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto con su cónyuge y su menor hija en El Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales menores desde hace varios años, en la parte posterior de su domicilio tiene un corral donde los cría, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para engorde y una segunda parte para engorde de los mismos.
texts.en:
Flormira is 51 years old and lives with her partner and youngest daughter in Playa Azul village, a rural area in the district of Pucará. Located in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in Peru's norther highlands, the people in Pucará make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Flormira has been making a living raising and selling young animals for a number of years. She carries out this work at the rear of her house, where she has a small farm. Flormira has applied for a loan of 4000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy animals and feed to fatten them up.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large door to store his motorbike in a more secure place.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 30-year-old mother of six children. She runs a small sewing business. She also prints elei designed lavalava and sells them to members of the community and also to the public in town. She has been doing this for more than two years, and she has managed to maintain the operation of her business with the profits she was able to make. 

Matalena plans to purchase fabric materials, design boards, fabric paint, paint brushes or rolls for her business with the loan she is getting. Matalena hopes to reinvest the money she will earn from her sales back into the business and also to assist with her family's financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials, design boards, fabric paint, paint brushes or rollers

loans.name: Puao

texts.en: Puao is a 52-year-old, married woman with three children. She runs a small sewing business which she has had for more than six years. The people in her community and her usual clients come to her to have their dresses and shirts made. She plans to use this money from this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, fabric materials, thread, and a sewing table for sewing business. With the profits she has been making from her business she has been able to improve the livelihood of her family, thanks in part to the SPBD program.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, fabric materials, thread, and a sewing table.

loans.name: Sira Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 19 novembre 2013 et composé de  femmes très actives dans  leurs activités génératrices a été rejoint par 05 nouvelles adhésions dans son second cycle vu l’impact positif du banc villageois dans les conditions de vie des familles des membres. Les femmes vivent dans le même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sira  (accroupie à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants  (03 garçons et 04 filles). Elle fait de la transformation de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète le sac de graines non décortiqués à 7 500 Fr CFA, paie des frais de transformation en moyenne de 850 Fr CFA par sceau de 20 litres. Elle vend le sceau à 12 000 Fr CFA dans les marchés hebdomadaire de la zone. 
   
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner pour 05 sacs de graines non décortiqués pour la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices lui servent d’épargne d’une part et d’autre par à soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created November 19, 2013 and consists of women who are very active with their income-generating activities. Five new members have joined the group for its second loan cycle, given the positive impact the "banc villageois" loan association had on the living conditions of the members' families.

The women live in the same village and get along together very well. Their main activity is small retail business.

Mrs. Sira (squatting at the far right with her right hand raised), is the group's featured borrower. She is 54, married and the mother of seven children (three boys and four girls).

She processes groundnut paste. She buys a bag of unshelled groundnuts for 7,500 CFA francs, pays average processing costs of 850 CFA francs per 20-liter bucket. She sells the bucket for 12,000 CFA francs in local weekly markets. 
   
With this loan she plans to resupply with five bags of unshelled groundnuts for processing and sale.

Her profits will be put into savings and also used to support her husband with daily expenditures.

loans.use: purchase five bags of unshelled groundnuts for processing and sale.

loans.name: Ruth Sonia

texts.es: La señora Ruth tiene 20 años, élla se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado  camélido como llamas y alpacas para su posterior venta, ella vive en la localidad de Palcoco, este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Ruth va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado camélido para tener una mejor producción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, la señora Ruth enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio, la señora Ruth va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y también comprar forraje para su ganado, la señora Ruth desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de ganado, El es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth, 20, earns a living raising camelid livestock like llamas and alpacas for later sale.  She lives in the town of Palcoco.

This is Ruth's first loan with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy livestock to improve her production.  She's requesting the loan to improve her income.

The challenge Ruth faces is improving in her business.

Ruth's going to use her profits to improve her income and to buy fodder for her livestock.  She wants her business to grow.  She's a very hardworking and enterprising person who wants to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy camelid livestock

loans.name: Sarlyn

texts.en:
Sarlyn previously accessed a 27,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase more quantities of car parts and accessories to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the loan for her direct selling business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sarlyn hopes to be successful in her business and dreams that her children will all finish their educations. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
