* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Betty and her husband are striving hard to sustain their daily necessities. She is 52 years old and has two adult  children. She owns and manages a small retail store while her husband cultivates their farm land. To generate more income, Betty wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demand. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and mushrooms to resell. She is hoping that she will further improve the  business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and mushrooms to resell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a widow who manages a retail store in order to sustain her family's needs. She has had her business for more than five years and it runs smoothly. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she can use it to improve her farm, which she used her previous loan to develop. Erlinda gathered a better harvest from her farm this year, which helped her family a lot. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy more grocery goods for her retail store. In the future, she hopes to continue improving her harvests and the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. 

She wants to start a canteen business selling different cooked food and savories to the school kids from their community and also from neighboring villages. That is why she has joined the SPBD the program in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

With this money, she plans to purchase a cooking stove, gas bottle, flour, sugar, cooking oil, wok, yeast, containers, and coconuts for her canteen business. 

Sofia plans on saving the profit she will be getting from her business so that she could reinvest it back to the business, and also to meet the financial obligations of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove, gas bottle, flour, sugar, cooking oil, wok, yeast, containers, and coconuts

loans.name: Malia Kiose

texts.en:
Malia is a 19-year-old single lady who runs a small canteen business and has been doing this for 2 years. She sells to the school kids, and also members of her community. 

With this loan, she plans to purchase a cooking stove, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, a large cooking pot, flour, cooking oil, soya, onions, and yeast for her meat buns to sell at the canteen. 

She has managed to help out with her family's financial obligations with the profits she was earning from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, a large cooking pot, flour, cooking oil, soya, onions, and yeast

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 66 años de edad, hace varios años su  esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvieron dos  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella hace muchos años aprendió corte y confección. 
Doña Zoila tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí elabora todo tipo de prendas ya sea para niños o damas, en época de entrada a clase está muy ocupada ya que es cuando más trabajo tiene confeccionando uniformes de escuelas y colegios. También se dedica a la venta de ropa con su hija, llevan más de 6 años con la venta de ropa y  con sus costuras casi toda la vida, es a punta de su esfuerzo como ella ayudo a su marido a salir adelante y hoy en día le da para salir adelante ya que esta sola.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque en el banco le han dado mucho apoyo para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Crédito Desarrollo Femenino group meet every two weeks in the Calderon parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious food and its vegetation.  Most of its residents are farmers and merchants.

Zoila lives here.  She is 66 years old and it’s been several years since her husband passed away. They had two children who are now adults and on their own.  She learned to make clothing a long time ago.

Zoila has a sewing workshop in her home.  There she makes all types of clothing for woman and children.  She is very busy when the school season begins because she has more work making school uniforms.  She and her daughter also sell clothing and have been doing so for more than six years and has been sewing almost her entire life.  This is now she helped her husband get ahead and now she only gets herself ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, and other clothing.  She is a founding member of the lending group, serves as the bank secretary, and she likes it because they have given her lots of support so she can get ahead.  Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y  el menor de 15 años, tres estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Mariana es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del  hogar se dedica  a preparar hayacas (plato típico del campo manabita que es muy apreciado por las personas de otras ciudades), todos los días ella en la mañana prepara las hayacas, las mismas que luego manda a entregar con su esposo a la ciudad de Manta. Su marido se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, cuando realiza sus ventas también vende las hayacas que su esposa prepara. Lleva más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio con el cual se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar las hayacas, frutas y legumbres para su esposo. Lleva más de 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco. Sus sueños es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation. Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Mariana lives here. She is 49 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has four children. Her three adult children attend university. The youngest, who is 15 years old, attends school. Her husband is a businessman.

Mariana is a very good mother and wife. In order to help her husband support the household, she prepares hayacas (a typical manabita country dish that is enjoyed by people from other towns). Every morning she prepares hayacas that her husband later delivers to the city of Manta. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables, and while he makes his sales he also sells the hayacas that his wife prepares. She has worked in this business for more than 23 years, which is how she earns a living.

She will use this loan to buy ingredients for the hayacas, and fruits and vegetables for her husband. She has been with the communal bank for nine years, and she likes the bank because of the support it provides.

Her dream is to continue advancing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for hayacas, and to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leslier

texts.es:
Leslier tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural du población es amable y organizado, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cuyes, patos, pollo), con varios años de experiencia en el negocio, también se dedica a las labores agrícolas – jornalaría, trabajando las parcelas de sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales de corral para engorde y lo comercializarlo en los restaurants de su distrito.
texts.en:
Leslier is 43 years old. He lives with his spouse and his son in the municipality of Nueva Arica, which is a rural area. Its people are nice and organized. They mostly work in farming, commerce, and livestock. Nueva Arica is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Peru. 

Together with his wife, he raises and sells farmyard animals (guinea pigs, ducks, and chicken) he has been doing this for several years. He also works in farming (day laborer). He works in the plots of his neighbors and other inhabitants of his district.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 SOLES to Edpyme Alternativa , to buy farmyard animals  to fatten them up and sell them in the restaurants around his area.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten them up and to sell them in the restaurants around his area.

loans.name: Aura Ramona

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Aura, tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Aura es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante se dedica a realizar una actividad que le encanta, los fines de semana prepara y vende comida en un local de su casa, lugar hasta donde acuden sus clientes a servirse sus deliciosos platos, los otros días de la semana vende bebidas de toda clase en su casa. Ella también se dedica con su marido a la venta de machetes, (herramienta de trabajo muy utilizado por los campesinos de la zona), lleva más de 30 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque en todo este tiempo le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the Desarrollo Femenino communal bank meet every two weeks in Calderón parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its rich cuisine and for its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants engage in agriculture and commerce in general. 

This is where Aura lives. She is 72 years old, married and has seven adult children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant.

Aura is a very determined woman who in order to succeed engages in a business that she loves. On weekends she prepares and sells food from her home,a place where customers come to be served her delicious dishes. The other days of the week she sells drinks of all kinds from her home. With her husband she also sells machetes (a work tool much used by rural people in the area). She has been in this business for more than 30 years, with which she helps her husband to keep going.

She is going to use this loan to buy food supplies for preparing her dishes. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning, and likes it because in all this time they have helped her a great deal. Her dream is to keep going with her business and to have good health.

loans.use: To buy food supplies.

loans.name: Tiresa

texts.en: Tiresa is a 41-year-old, married woman with seven children. She runs a small plantation business and she sells the produce to members of the community and also to the traveling public. She plans to use this loan to purchase a mist blower, a wheel barrow, fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpener, and taro roots for her plantation business. She has been with the program for more than six years and has been able to improve the living standards of her family with her business profits. With her profits, she plans to expand her business, save, and also make sure that her family's financial obligations are met.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower, a wheel barrow, fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpener, and taro roots.

loans.name: Mariela Ramona

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de 14 años, dos de ellas estudian en universidad y colegio y son las aun  vive con ellos. Su esposo es panadero.
Doña Mariela junto a su familia tienen una panadería en la ciudad,  trabajan todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, ya que ellos en la noche preparan la masa que al otro día hornean ya que el pan tiene que estar listo desde la madrugada para sus clientes, también preparan tortas y dulces de todos los sabores, su local es muy concurrido ya que no hay otro cerca por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas. Son más de 5 años que se dedican a esta actividad con lo cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos y otros ingredientes  para preparar el pan. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos cada vez mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the Desarrollo Femenino communal bank meet every two weeks in Calderón parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its rich cuisine and for its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants engage in agriculture and commerce in general.

This is where Mariela  lives. She is 49 years old, married, and has three adult children and one 14-year-old. Two of them attend university and high school and still live with them. Her husband is a baker.

Mariela and her family have a bakery in the city and work every day from 5 AM until 8 PM and sometimes until later, as at night they prepare the dough that they bake the next day, as the bread has to be ready in the early morning for their customers. They also prepare pastries and sweets of every flavor. Their shop is very busy as there is not another one nearby, so their sales are very good. They have been engaged in this business for five years, and with that they are moving forward in life. 

This loan is to buy flour, eggs and other ingredients for preparing the bread. She has been in the communal bank for four years and likes it because with the loans she continues to improve her business. 

Her goals are to keep going with the business and for her business to grow each day.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Together with her husband, she works to sustain the needs of her family. They aim to improve their standard of living and educate their children. With this in mind, Lolita would like to improve her small store to generate sufficient income. Due to inadequate capital, she would like a loan of PHP8,000 to buy additional stock of laundry soaps, canned goods, snack foods, seasonings, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to sell. Through this loan, Lolita believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of laundry soaps, canned goods, snack foods, seasonings, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Shinebileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinebileg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her husband drives a minivan around the city to provide transportation services to local people. She helps her husband by working as a conductor, and they have been doing their business for more than ten years. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Mongolia Tughrik (MNT) to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, shingles and fiberglass for house renovation. 

Her house has been bombarded with strong snow and rain and became fragile and vulnerable. So renovation is necessary, and after renovation, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve her family's living.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Silvia Margarita

texts.es: Silvia tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija de 10 años y su hijo de 6 años de edad . Silvia posee un negocio de tortillas desde hace 6 años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Silvia desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y teja para reparar el techo y parte de las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Silvia, 36, lives in a house she owns with her husband, 10-year-old daughter and 6-year-old son. Silvia has owned a tortilla-making business for 6 years and that is how she provides for the family. Silvia wants to improve the conditions of her home, which is why she has decided to ask for a loan from the partner institution, FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood and tiles to repair the roof and part of the walls of the house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and tiles to repair the roof and part of the walls of her home.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en: Kilisitina is a 57-year-old, married woman with five children. She has a small vegetable garden business and also a small pig farm. She sells her vegetables to members of her community and the traveling public. People also come to her when they need a medium-sized piglet for a special occasion. Kilisitina makes good money from her business and she has been operating it for more than three years. With this loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers, vegetable seeds for her vegetable garden business, and one sow (a female pig) for her pig farm. She has been able to help out with their family's financial obligations from time to time with the profits she has been earning from her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and one sow (a female pig).

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has mastered her hog-raising business in Plaridel. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. 

When she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Similar to how she takes care her hog-raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good-standing, so she can always run there for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 20,000 will help her to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
For more than 12 years, Virginia has been working on her own farm to make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for farming. She earns well from her farm which helps her to improve her swine-fattening business. 

Recently, Virginia took a new loan in order to purchase feeding supplies.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 53 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico con su hijo de 13 años de edad el cual cursa secundaria en Colegio Nacional del distrito de Pucara, que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado caprino, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como aves para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio que le permitan generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila is 53 years old. She lives in her own house (made out of rustic material) with her 13 years old son. He goes to middle school in the Colegio Nacional in the district of Pucara (it has water and electricity). Its population work in farming, commerce, and cattle-raising. Pucara is located in the province of Jaen, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the north mountain range of Peru.

She raises and sales goats, hens, and guinea pigs. Her business is located in the back of her house.
She has requested a 500 NUEVOS SOLES loan to Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals as birds, to fatten them up and offer them at a higher price to allow her make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten them up.

loans.name: Margarita Elionor

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante y artesano.
Doña Margarita junto a su esposo  para salir adelante se dedican al comercio, ellos tiene un gran local en el cual venden víveres de toda clase, electrodomésticos y  muebles que su marido fabrica, el por su parte tiene  un taller de ebanistería en el cual elabora todo tipo de muebles, camas, puertas, entre otras obras, allí el trabaja con la ayuda de dos personas a quien le paga por su labor, este taller lo tiene junto al local en el cual ella se encarga de sus ventas. Tienen más de 30 años que se dedican a esta actividad con la cual sacan adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres y madera para el taller del marido. Este es su 4 ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo Femenino” communal bank meet every two weeks in the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its delicious food and for its vegetation. Most of its residents are involved in farming and general business.

Margarita lives here. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Two children still live with them. Her husband is a businessman and artisan.

Along with her husband, Margarita works in business. They have a large store where they sell various supplies, electric appliances, and furniture that her husband makes. He has a woodworking shop where he makes all types of furniture, beds, doors, and others. He works there with the help of two employees. The workshop is located next to the store, where Margarita is in charge of the sales. They have provided for their family in this way for over 30 years.

Margarita will use this loan to buy supplies and wood for her husband’s workshop. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank. She likes it because the loans are quick.

Her goal is to continue advancing her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and wood.

loans.name: Yeceña Marina

texts.es: Yeceña: Es una mujer alegre y sociable, tiene 42 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos, cuenta con una experiencia de más de una década de ser docente de secundaria. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos, postes y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su familia.
texts.en: Meet Yeceña, a happy, friendly woman of 42 years of age. She is married and has six children. She also has more than a decade of experience as a high school teacher. With the goal of improving her home, she is requesting her first loan, which she will use to buy construction materials such as wood, zinc sheet metal, nails, and posts, and also to cover labor costs. She dreams of having a home that will provide her family with adequate living conditions.

loans.use: buy construction materials and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Julia Gladis

texts.es: Julia, se siente muy a gusto por el servicio que ha recibido en Padecomsm y la facilidad de pago que se le brinda, opta por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para tener a su disposición los materiales básicos para elaborar los arreglos florales (con flores artificiales y naturales) así como también recuerdos, comprara papel, listones, flores naturales, colorantes, alambre, espelma, espuma y plástico. Con el préstamo anterior adquirió materia prima por mayor ahorrándose un poco en la compra, ha podido aumentar su productividad, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is happy with the service provided by the partner institution, Padecomsm, and the payment facilities she is offered. She has decided to ask for a new loan to have at her disposal the basic materials she needs to prepare flower arrangements (with artificial and natural flowers) as well as keepsakes.
She will buy paper, ribbons, natural flowers, coloring, wire, wax, floral foam and plastic flowers.
With her previous loan, she acquired raw materials in bulk, saving some money in the purchase. She has been able to increase productivity and her family has a better life style.

loans.use: to purchase paper, ribbons, natural flowers, coloring, wire, wax, floral foam and plastic flower arrangements.

loans.name: Enaida

texts.es: Enaida: Es originaria de Waspam, casada con 5 hijos, en edad escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de 5 años de ser docente. Desde hace 14 años que no cambia la madera de su vivienda. Con el propósito mejorar su vivienda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales: madera rustica y cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establece un negocio y tener una casa de concreto.
texts.en:
Enaida is a native of Waspam. She is married with five school-age children. She has over five years of experience as a teacher.

It has been 14 years since she changed the wood of her home. Hoping to improve her home, she requests her first loan to cover the costs of labor and to buy materials: rough-cut and planed lumber, and nails. Her dream is to establish a business and have a concrete house.

loans.use: to change the wood of her house built on stilts.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra: Es originaria de Waspan, tiene 41 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos. Primeramente había solicitado financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda, sin embargo, recientemente su hijo tuvo un accidente y con el objetivo de apoyar a la salud de su hijo solicita financiamiento para trasladarlo a Managua, para que le realicen estudios médicos, debido  un accidente, le afecto la visión. Su sueño es que su hijo recobre la visión, establecer en su vivienda un pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Meet Mayra. She's originally from Waspam. She's 41 years old and is married with five children. She had first asked for a loan to improve her home, but her son recently had an accident which affected his sight. To help him and support his health, she is requesting a loan so that she can take him to Managua, so that they can perform medical tests on him.  Mayra dreams that her son will recover his vision, and that she can establish a small business in her home.

loans.use: get her son the medical attention he needs

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan: Es originario de Waspam, tiene 38 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 10 años que no cambia la madera de su casa de tambo. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción. Su sueño es una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Juan is from Waspam.  He is 38 years old, and married with two school-age children.  He has not replaced the wood on his stilt house for ten years.  He is requesting a loan to improve his home and purchase building materials.  His dream is to have a cement home.

loans.use: to replace the wood on his stilt home.

loans.name: Indiana

texts.es: Indiana: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Con el objetivo de construir su vivienda, solicita este financiamiento, para cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer un negocio.
texts.en: Indiana is from Waspam. She is 50 years old and a single mother with three children. She is requesting this loan to cover labor costs, with the aim of building her home. Her dream is to set up a business.

loans.use: To cover labor costs.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio es una persona que esta luchando para poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Comenta que este es su tercer préstamo con kiva, y que el ultimo lo uso en la compra de panificados para la venta.
Ignacio pide este préstamo para poder comprar nuevamente mas panificados, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a person who is fighting to be able to get ahead and improve his and his family's life conditions. He says that this is his third loan with Kiva and that he used the last one for the purchase of baked goods to sell.

Ignacio requests this loan to be able to again buy more baked goods, which will allow him to continue with his sales as he has been doing. He appreciates this new opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica: Es originaria de Waspan, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años.  Con el propósito de  apoyar a su mamá y mejorarle su vivienda solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: maderas, zinc, clavos, postes y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura con las condiciones adecuadas y velar por la educación de su hijo.
texts.en: Meet Yessica. She's originally from Waspam. She's 30 years old and the single mother of a 10-year-old son.  In order to help her mother and improve her home, she is requesting this second loan to buy construction materials (such as wood, zinc metal, nails, and posts) and pay for manual labor. She dreams of having a secure home with adequate living conditions and of being able to look out for her son's education.

loans.use: help her mother and improve her home

loans.name: Javier Pedro

texts.es: Javier: Es originario de Waspam, tiene 38 años de edad, está casado con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de más de una década de ser docente. Desde hace 5 años habitaba en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, bloque, hierro y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener un inodoro con fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado.
texts.en: Javier is from Waspam.  He is 38 years old, and married with four school-age children.  He has over ten years’ experience as a teacher.  He has lived in a stilt wooden house for five years.  With the goal of gradually building his concrete home, he is requesting a loan to purchase building materials such as cement, blocks, iron, and cover labor costs.  His dream is to have a toilet with a septic tank because the latrine he currently has is in fair condition.

loans.use: to gradually build his concrete home.

loans.name: Livinston

texts.es: Livinston: Tiene 40 años de edad, es originario de Waspam, casado, tiene 4 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace 14 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el objetivo de construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas y establecer un negocio.
texts.en: Livinston is 40 years old and is from Waspam. He is married and has four school-aged children.  He has lived in a wooden stilt house for 14 years. He is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, cement and rebar and cover labor costs, with the aim of building a wooden dwelling with concrete lower walls. His dream is to provide his family with a proper home and to set up a business.

loans.use: To construct a wooden dwelling with concrete lower walls.

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en:
Filiga is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small canteen business selling to the school children and also members of her community. She also makes ice pops to be also sold at her canteen.

She has been doing this for 2 years and she needs financial assistance to maintain the operation of her business. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, she plans to purchase sacks of rice, chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, flour, sugar, cordial, and plastic bags for her business. She has planned to save some of her profits as much as possible so that she could provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, flour, sugar, cordial, and plastic bags

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comite San Cayetano son  de la zona de San Lorenzo son 17 integrantes  muy responsables, todas son muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier inquietud.
La  señora Virginia es vendedora de productos de primera necesidad, ya que tiene una despensa bien variada con la cual está generando los ingresos para poder seguir creciendo. Ella está luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Virginia quiere comprar frutas, verduras, carne, lácteos y demás productos para poder surtir su negocio, y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano committee is from the San Lorenzo area. There are 17 very responsible members. All of them are very responsible and hardworking. They always get together to resolve any concern.

Virginia is a vendor of basic necessity products, given that she has a store with a good variety with which she is generating income to be able to continue growing. She is fighting to be able to grow and get ahead through her work.

Virginia wants to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, and dairy and other products to be able to stock her business and in that way continue giving her clients all they ask for.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, and dairy and other products.

loans.name: Vaoiva

texts.en:
Vaoiva, a 47-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a small shop in her village for more than two years, with money from her sales being reinvested back into the business. She has requested a loan to purchase a new display cooler for her shop. 

Vaoiva has thus far managed to do well in her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a display cooler

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pyahu está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder trabajar para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudelina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en su nivel medio. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace está ayudando a su familia y les da todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy luchadora y por sobre todo muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para vender, y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Claudelina agradece por la oportunidad de crecer que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The members of the Pyahu communal bank are participating in the poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to understand the living situation of each one of them and according to that be able to work to move forward in life.

One of the member is Claudelina, who on her last survey showed a poverty level of two, that is to say at the medium level. Through her effort and constant work and through the sale of clothing that she does, she is helping her family and gives them everything that she was not able to have. 

She is a very determined woman and above all very self-sacrificing, who wants to succeed. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of clothing to sell and that way continue giving her customers everything they ask for. 

Claudelina is grateful for the opportunity to grow that she is receiving and which will allow her to continue growing in her ventures.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: La Fortuna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la fortuna, es un grupo nuevo, que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando sus vidas, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, por medio de la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello podrán trabajar y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel medio de ingresos, ella a  través del trabajo en la venta de joyas, está luchando por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas  para la venta, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Fortuna.” It is a new group, whose members want to advance and improve their lives. The members participate in the “Poverty Stoplight” survey, which identifies the situation of each woman and how she can work and grow.

One of the members is Silvia, who showed an average level of income in her survey. By selling jewelry, she fights to get ahead and give her family everything that she could not have.

Silvia requests this loan to buy a variety of jewelry to sell. With the loan she can continue her work, striving to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en el 3er ciclo. Están iniciando con muchas expectativas este 3er ciclo, que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así poder salir de la pobreza. 
Felicia integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de leche, que hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere ir creciendo por medio de su trabajo, ya que asi da a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
Felicia quiere seguir creciendo es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar leche por cantidad, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is in its third loan cycle.  They are starting this new cycle with high hopes.  They want to invest so that they can have more income in their households and rise out of poverty.

Felicia is a member of this group.  She has a business selling milk.  She does this work every day from the early morning hours.  She is a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to continue to grow through her work, because this way she can give her family everything she was not able to have.

Felicia wants to continue to grow, and so she is requesting this loan to buy milk in bulk so that she can continue with her sales.  She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Bella Fe

texts.en:
Bella Fe is 49 years old and married. She was gifted with two children who are attending school. She owns and manages a small bakeshop within the local community while her husband works abroad. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to improve her small bake shop to generate a higher income. She plans to prepare more kinds of bread recipes to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, sugar, yeast, oil and plastics needed in the bakeshop. 

She is hoping that she will be granted her loan request so she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, oil and plastics needed in the bakeshop.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tinyfer

texts.en:
Tinyfer is 32 years old, married and a resident of Locus, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They are blessed with 3 children. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling. 

She started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with a capital of 1,000 PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, she was able to manage it well, and is able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2008. She was able to avail herself of three loans and reimbursed them religiously. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to finance the purchase of additional stock for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maryuri Esperanza

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Maryuri, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 6 años, la menor estudia en escuela, ambos aun  viven con ellos. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Maryuri es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que lo utilice en su negocio, el se dedica a la compra y venta de maní molido, el recorre los campos y lugares donde compra al por mayor y luego en su casa empaca en fundas, luego se desplaza a otras ciudades a entregar este producto que es muy utilizado para preparar deliciosos alimentos. Lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual les da lo necesario para vivir.
Este crédito es para comprar maní. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Calderón parish of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the loan group Desarrollo Femenino (Women's Development) meet. This area is known for its delicious cuisine and vegetation. The majority of its residents work in agriculture or general commerce.

Maryuri, a 36 year old woman, lives in this area. She is married, and has two children from this union, who are 6 and 19 years old. The younger one goes to school, and both live with their parents. Her husband is a merchant.

Maryuri is a very good wife. To help her husband get the credit he uses in his business, she is engaged in buying and selling ground peanuts. 

She walks the fields and places where she buys in bulk, and later packages peanuts in bags at her house, then takes them to other cities to deliver this product, which is widely used to prepare delicious foods.

She's spent more than five years in this business, which gives her family what they need to live.

The loan is to buy peanuts. She's been in the loan group for more than two years, and she likes it because of the help the bank gives her. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
In 2008, Paciencia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. She has focused on farming which is something she feels she is good at. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

She borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Paciencia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, a 33-year-old mother of two, is married to a farmer. Mary Ann's store is her means of earning a living in support of her family.  She runs it well, even though there is increased competition from other stores.   

Mary Ann has reached her fourth year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional stocks for her store, as expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. 

A hardworking mother, Mary Ann wishes to sustain the store and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz: Es una joven originaria de Waspam, tiene 25 años, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 5 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA, le han permitido comprar un local en el mercado municipal. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Waspam. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Alba Luz is a young woman from Waspam. She's 25 years old, and married with two school-age children. With the goal of having her own source of income, she started a small general store in her home about five years ago. Thanks to her net income and from previous PANA PANA loans, she has been able to buy a site in the city market. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy merchandise in Managua and sell it at reasonable prices back home in Waspam. She dreams of having a home made out of concrete.

loans.use: buy merchandise in Managua for resale

loans.name: Lkhanaajav

texts.en:
Mrs. Lkhanaajav, 49 years old, lives with her only son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her son both have been working as electricians at power plant since 2009. Her husband passed away early and she alone raised her son. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to insulate her home and build barn next to it. Her family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land and in winter time, they burn lots of coal for heating so building a barn next to it will preserve energy and reduce coal usage. Also insulation with fiberglass will increase the heat-preserving capacity.

loans.use: to insulate her home and build a barn.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulamsuren, 54 years old, lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an educational manager since 2006 at a special school for children with dysphasia. 

Using her previous loan, Dulamsuren insulated her house walls and installed electric heating in the floor. Now she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to repair the roof, after which the house will be protected against snowfall and rain droplets. Also during winter time, she will be able to further reduce coal usage for heating, thereby releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Arvin-Jervie

texts.en:
Arvin-Jervie is 27 years old, married and has two children. His wife is a food vendor while he is a farmer planting and harvesting corn for income. He also pays laborers who help him in the farming business. 

Arvin-Jervie hopes to improve his crop production but to achieve this, he must sustain his crops with enough farm inputs. For this reason, he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in corn farming. 

Someday, with good income from the business, he will save funds and keep providing a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in corn farming.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion has been operating a retail business for more than eleven years, earning well to make a living. The business is doing well and she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She had a better income from this, but it all goes for their daily expenditures. So instead, she is seeking ways to augment her business. She took a loan recently in order to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, a 49-year-old mother, supports her husband in generating income to sustain their necessities and support the education of her four children. She is engaged in buying and reselling various vegetables within the local community. She has been in the business for almost six years. 

She aims to acquire more vegetables to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, Janet is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of tomatoes, squash, onions, eggplant, beans, cabbages and leafy vegetables to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, squash, onions, eggplant, beans, cabbages and leafy vegetables to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jebie

texts.en:
Jebie helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. For many years in the field of fishing, the couple have been able to sustain their needs. With her generated income, her previous loan used for fishing nets and hook was successfully repaid. She took a new loan recently to repair her existing fishing boat.

Being positive about the future, she longs to become successful in her business so she can expand in some neighboring areas.

loans.use: to repair her existing fishing boat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old, married, with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a business, selling lumber in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of lumber to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 44 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Desde hace 5 años que no cambia la madera de su vivienda. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda solicita su primer financiamiento para construir de concreto los postes de su vivienda de tambo de madera, comprar materiales de construcción: hierro, cemento, bloque y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa de dos pisos de concreto.
texts.en: Meet Hilda, from the city of Waspam. She's 44 years old, and is married with 6 children. Four are all grown up and two are teenagers in high school. She hasn't changed the wood of her home in five years. With the goal of improving her home, she is requesting this first loan to 1) build the posts of her wood-frame home from concrete, 2) buy construction materials including iron, cement, and blocks, and 3) cover the costs of manual labor. Her dream is to one day have a two-story home made of concrete.

loans.use: rebuild the support posts in her home from concrete

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 43-year-old, married woman, with five children. She runs a small barbecue business and also has a small piggery farm, where people come to her to buy medium-sized piglets for special occasions. She sells her barbecue to the members of the public. 

Theresa plans to use this loan to purchase a new barbecue grill for her barbecue business, plus fencing wire, cement, and sand for her pigsty (piggery farm). 

With the profits she has been getting from her business, Theresa has managed to improve her family's living standards. But, she plans to save some more money in order to expand her business and provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a barbecue grill, fencing wire, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita está casada y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
La Sra. Margarita pide este préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, yerba, gaseosa, cerveza, etc., y de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.-
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer, ya que de esa manera podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar, a con lo cual puede ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is married and says that she has a well-stocked general store in her house, where she has all types of products that she offers to her clients.

Margarita requests this loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, mate, soft drinks, beer, etc., and in that way she will offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

She appreciates this opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow, given that in that way she will be able to continue with her work, fighting to improve, which will allow her to help her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, mate, soft drinks, beer, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es cliente recurrente de la fundación, cuenta con una despensa en su casa, que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar, ella realiza venta de todo tipo de productos, como lácteos, carnes, embutidos, artículos de primera necesidad, etc. Vive con su marido e hijos, y juntos llevan adelante el crecimiento y desarrollo del negocio. 
Ella pide este préstamo ya que ve la necesidad de surtir su negocio con más productos, como ser bebidas, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Maria is a recurring client of the foundation. She has a general store in her house, which she was able to set up with much sacrifice. She sells all types of products, like dairy products, meat, sausage, basic necessities, etc. 

She lives with her husband and children, and together they advance the growth and development of the business.

She requests this loan because she sees the need to stock her business with more products, such as drinks, dairy products, sausage, meat, and other items, so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing, giving her clients what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, sausage, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno está a su cargo, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de tamales desde hace 32 años en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a la elaboración del producto a la 01:00 pm finalizándola a las 06:00 pm posterior al día siguiente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a ofertar su producto desde las 05:30 am y finalizando las ventas a las 04:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a domingo, realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.   

Doña Dolores, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para la compra de productos tales como: maíz, queso, bolsas plásticas y cal al por mayor con precios más accesibles para la elaboración de tamales y así lograr mayores ventas incrementando sus ingresos los cuales le permitirán poseer un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores is a single mother of 3 children, none of whom are in her care. She has been earning a living by preparing and selling tamales in one of the markets in the city of Leon for 32 years. She begins preparing the tamales at 1 pm and finishes up at 6 pm. The next day, she goes to her stall to sell the food from 5:30 am until 4 pm. She has the same schedule from Monday through Sunday. She does this work to provide for her home.

Dolores has requested a loan from Ceprodel to use to buy products such as corn, cheese, plastic bags, and lime powder in bulk in order to buy at better prices for her tamales business, and therefore enjoy greater sales and earnings which will allow her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, plastic bags, and lime powder.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Waspan, tiene 40 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, desde hace 3 años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Solicita su segundo financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada y rustica, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su familia.
texts.en: She is a hardworking 40 year old woman with three children.  She started building her frame house three years ago so she can live securely and with dignity.  She is asking for a second loan to buy finished and rustic lumber, nails, and pay for labor so she can build her house little by little.  Her dream is to have a home to provide her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Encarnacion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Encarnación está en el ciclo número 7 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, Directora General del Comité, quien se dedica a la venta de Ropas y además es funcionaria privada. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido salir adelante y brindar un bienestar a su hogar. Su esposo también trabaja por lo tanto aporta un ingreso al hogar. 
La Sra. Teresa solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos en general para su venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Encarnación Group is in its 7th loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs program, where they all work together and help each other get ahead. Teresa is one of the members and the Director General of the Committee. She earns a living by selling clothing and also works as an employee in the private sector. Thanks to these jobs, she has been able to get ahead and ensure the well being of her home. Her husband also works, and thus contributes income to the household.

Teresa is requesting this loan to buy general merchandise to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, trousers and other articles, so that she can continue with her work as she has been doing to date. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will be very helpful in allowing her to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, trousers and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг родилась в 1972 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети школьники. Садбарг и ее муж стараются обеспечить своих детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Ее муж работает в заводе. Садбарг уже более 10 лет занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. Она имеет собственный магазин по продажи продуктов питания. Она старается обеспечить своих покупателей высококачественными и свежими продуктами питания. Садбарг запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sadbarg was born in 1972. She is married and has three school-age children. She and her husband try to provide all of the necessities for their children. Her husband works in a factory and she has more than ten years of experience buying and selling food products. She has her own grocery store and tries to provide her customers with high-quality, fresh foods. Sadbarg has requested a loan for 5,000 somoni to buy food and increase working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food products and increase working capital

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry's main source of income comes from fishing. It is his way of providing for the family. 

He lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with his family. He wants to give a better living to his family in the future, and that's the reason for his determination to improve in his field of business. 

To buy fishing nets, he is borrowing a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative which he has recently joined.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 44 years old and married with four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Laumua

texts.en: Laumua is a 24-year-old single mother of one child. She operates a small retail shop which has been in operation for more than three years. Laumua plans to use this loan to restock her shop with items such as sacks of sugar, flour, and rice; and  boxes of corned beef, canned fish, chicken leg quarters,  mutton flaps, and sausages. Laumua has managed to expand her shop since she joined SPBD and has earned a decent profit, not only to reinvest back to the business and also to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, flour, and rice; and boxes of corned beef, canned fish, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, and sausages

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que conforme al resultado de esta podrán trabajar para crecer y salir adelante.
Miriam pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas de estación, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas, pues ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, pues por medio de ello da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Agradecen todas por la oportunidad de crecimiento que están recibiendo, y con lo que podrán seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupry Group is doing an investigation of poverty elimination, that as the result of this they will be able to work in order to grow and come out ahead. 

Miriam is asking for this loan for the purchase of fresh seasonal fruits, since with this she will be able to continue with her sales as she is dedicated to the sale of fruits. By way of this she gives her family everything they need for the day to day. 

They are all grateful for the opportunity of growth that they are receiving and with which they will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Robel

texts.en:
Robel finds pleasure in his chosen business. He sells barbeque during the nighttime. This is convenient for him because he can prepare his stock during daytime. This is how he supports his family. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to buy raw ingredients for his barbeque business. He wishes to earn more by opening another food stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for his barbeque business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She decided to give it a try after she learned she can obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. 

She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. 

Jenelyn wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric lives in Callao with his family. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is a corn farmer and his wife is a hog raiser. In his farming business, he generates about PHP 10,000 each harvest season which pays for food and other expenses at home and education expenses. Eric hoped to increase his income but has had insufficient funds. That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to use in his business. He will buy fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides used in farming. It will help him maintain good crop production. Eric will use the additional revenue for education purposes and also invest in his wife's hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a businesswoman from Plaridel. She is a 54-year-old widow and has expertise in selling. 

She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she is obtaining a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: France

texts.en: France is 44 years old and personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo De  Crédito Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 3 años, los mayores  estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es albañil. 
Doña María es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de la marca Leonisa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana ya sea en horas de la mañana o cuando puede, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para darles una buena educación a sus pequeños ya que a su marido no le alcanza para esto.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De  Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Calderón parish in Portoviejo city, the members of the Grupo De Crédito Desarrollo Femenino [Women’s Development Credit Group] meet every 15 days. This area is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation, the majority of the inhabitants make a living in agriculture and general trade.

Señora María lives in this area. She is 36 years old and she is in a common law marriage. She and her husband have three children who are 14, 11 and 3 years old. The older two are in high school and grade school. Her husband works as a mason.

Doña María is a homemaker. In order to earn her own income, she works in catalog sales of Leonisa brand clothing, as well as Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works four days per week, for some hours in the morning or whenever she can. She delivers her products on credit and collects payments every 8 or 15 days. She has made a living for six years this way. With her income she helps giver her children a good education, which her husband does not make enough to do.

This loan is to buy perfumes lotions, cosmetics and undergarments. She has been in the Credit Group for five years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot with her business. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and undergarments.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired supporting her family. Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pigpens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is 40 years old, married, and has 10 children, seven in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Lyn has a business selling personal care products in the Philippines. Ma. Lyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soap, body lotion and other personal care products.

Ma. Lyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, body lotion and other personal care products.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife has a position of manager at a private firm. Their son goes elementary school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to install vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors. After installing those items, his family will live in a more comfortable and warmer place, burning less coal for heating and releasing less pollution into air.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 49 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and earns a living from managing a car radiator repair shop together with her husband as the repairman. 

She signed up for membership to access financial assistance. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair shop business. 

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to expand their radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper, and other accessories and materials.

loans.name: Nurkhon

texts.ru: Нурхон вдова. Она потеряла своего мужа несколько лет назад. Он умер от болезни. Нурхон живет с детьми. Она имеет 2 сыновей. Нурхон работает в заводе с 1999 года. Она 6 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес, так как ее семья нуждается дополнительному доходу. Она занимается выпечкой и продажей булочных изделий. Она имеет в ассортименте 12 наименований булочек. Нурхону помогает ее старший сын Умарали. Она хочет развевать и укрепить свой новый бизнес. Она планирует купить технику для лавки, а также купить сырья для производства булочек. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nurkhon is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago due to an illness. She lives with her two sons and has been working in a factory since 1999. Six months ago she started her own business, since her family needs additional income. She bakes and sells 12 different bread products with the help of her older son Umarali. Nurkhon wants to develop and strengthen her new business, and she plans to buy equipment for her shop as well as cheese for making buns. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients for her baking business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La Sra. Susana es comerciante y está casada con el Sr. Ricardo, tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya son independientes, y que pudieron criar con mucho sacrificio.
Ella tiene en su casa una despensa bien surtida y su marido tiene en el microcentro de la ciudad una mesita en cual vende ropas varias de manera ambulante.
Susana es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, con aceites, verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche y demás, agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Susana is a merchant and is married to Ricardo. They have 4 children, 2 of whom are independent, who they were able to raise with much a lot of sacrifice and dedication.

Susana has a well-stocked general store in her home, and her husband has a small set up downtown where he sells clothing as a street vendor. Susana is a very hardworking woman, and a fighter, and she is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various goods to stock her pantry with oils, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk, and more. She is grateful for this opportunity which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy oils, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk, and more, for her store.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 01 Juin 2007, et vient d’entamer son quatorzième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

 Madame Fatou (assise à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la transformation de graines d’arachide en patte qu’elle revente au marché hebdomadaire international de la sous région. Pour ce faire elle achète la graine d’arachide par sac ou par bassine selon l’offre du marché pour ensuite faire le tri, la cuisson et finalement la transformation à la machine pour obtenir la patte d’arachide revendu par seau de 15 ou 20 litres.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 04 sacs d’arachide de 50 kilos à 12 500 F CFA pour la transformation et la vente.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille d’une part et d’autre part de conforter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on June 1, 2007 and just started its fourteenth loan cycle. Despite the difficulty of maintaining income generating activities in the area, the group members remain determined and very courageous. The members are community-focused and live in the same village. The main business is small-scale retail, in addition to rain-fed agriculture. 

Fatou (seated on the right with her left hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 35 years old, married, and mother to 4 children: two boys and two girls. Her business consists of processing peanuts into a paste that she sells in the sub-region's weekly international market. To do this, she buys peanuts by the bag or by the tub, depending on what is available at the market, and sorts them, cooks them, and then processes them by machine into  peanut butter that she sells in 15- or 20-liter buckets. 

With this loan, she plans on buying four 50-kilo bags of peanuts at 12,500 CFA Francs each that she will process and sell. The income will enable her to help her husband manage the family's daily expenses, and also increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy four 50-kilo bags of peanuts at 12,500 CFA Francs each to process and sell.

loans.name: Deoniamae

texts.en:
Deoniamae wants to improve her living situation in the future. She studies at a university for her tertiary education. She is determined to finish her studies to gain a better job and wants to help her siblings gain a better education in the future.
 
She had joined GDMPC and borrowed to pay for her school uniforms, books, and other supplies. She is thankful enough to GDMPC for being a part of her journey

loans.use: to pay for her school uniforms, books and other supplies

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is single and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. Aside from this, he also grows and harvests bananas and sells them in town. After five years in farming, he has generated income for his needs and is saving for his future needs. His previous loan used for his farm was repaid successfully. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer intended for his banana farm.
He wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Robert
