Mirela needs this loan immediately because her mother-in-law has been getting chemotherapy sessions and due to the lack of money she hasn’t received the latest. While she makes a little income from her little activity, her husband works as a driver. They are indeed poor, like most of the members in their ethnic community.

loans.use: to pay for her mother-in-law's chemotherapy sessions

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been running a retail shop for the last five years with great success.She earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is married to Dixon and blessed with three children aged from 3 to 13 years. Nancy is applying for her second loan to buy more stock of sugar, sweets, and washing detergents to sell.

In future she desires to grow her business and expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, sweets, and washing detergents to her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish tanks and fish to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus, 39, has been a client of UGAFODE’s before. He is married with six children ranging in age from sixteen down to six, all of whom attend school.

In 2009 Deus started trading in cattle with customers from the city. He works hard three days a week and six hours a day dealing with his cattle. He is, however, faced with the challenges of competition from other cattle traders and his limited capital. The cattle trade requires a lot of money if one is to succeed.

Deus is applying for a 1,200,000 UGX loan to buy more young bulls to raise and trade. He is determined to grow his business through hard work and with UGAFODE and Kiva’s help. His future plans are to educate all of his children.

loans.use: TTo buy young bulls

loans.name: Nimio

texts.es:
Nimio está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad que le abrirá muchas puertas y le permitirá ser un gran profesional y ayudar a los demás.
Él se está esforzando al máximo, y su sueño es poder tener su propio estudio contable. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que con ello cubrirá ese gasto que tiene, que es considerable. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Nimio is studying for a degree in Accounting, which will open many doors and allow him to become a successful professional who can help others.

He is striving to do his best so that he can fulfill his dream of having his own accounting practice. Nimio is requesting this loan in order to cover his current degree expenses, which are considerable. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Veronica Daniela

texts.es: Daniela se dedica 2 años a la venta de pañales y productos de aseo personal, ella vive con su esposo y con su hijo 2 años, su esposo se dedica a la venta de pollos, Daniela comenta que lle va muy bien en su negocio ya que no existe mucha competencia, el credito lo va a invertir el  la compra de pañales y otros productos de cuidado personal, Daniela comenta que poco a poco esta construyendo una casita y que mediante su negocio espera terminar su casa y  ponerse su local propio y mientras atiende su negocio estar criando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Daniela has been working for two years in the sale of diapers and personal cleansing products. She lives with her husband and her two year old child. Her husband earns a living selling chickens. Daniela says that her business is going very well since she has little competition. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of diapers and other personal care products. Daniel says that little by little she is building a house and that through her business she hopes to finish her house, set up her own store and take raise her child while she tends the store.

loans.use: to buy diapers

loans.name: Sarorm's Group

texts.en:
A married woman living in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sarorm is 39 years old and has four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Sarorm is a teacher in the local area and she is also a rice farmer. She has been in this business for 11 years, earning about 70,000 KHR and able to save about 40,000 KHR each day.

Sarorm’s group consists of two members, who are both female. Sarorm has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Seanghai's Group

texts.en: Seanghai is a resident of Dambae district, located in Kampong Cham province. She is a 24 year-old mother of three dependent children who remain in school. The main source of income for her family is their cassava farm, which she has occupied for about six years now. Seanghai leads a group of two borrowers to request a loan of 6,000,000 KHR; her portion is 4,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use a portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay land plowing fees. Another portion will be used to buy a sugarcane juice squeezer to produce sugarcane juice for sale. She hopes to increase her income through the support of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay land plowing fees

loans.name: Johnny Boy

texts.en:
Johnny Boy is 35 years old.  He is married and blessed with an only child. 

Johnny Boy provides transportation services in the community and he earns well from this business, which is his main source of income. He has been running this business for more than five years. 

Johnny Boy is requesting this loan from GDMPC to cover the cost of motorcycle repair and maintenance.  In the future, he wants to give his family a better amd more comfortable life.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Phan, 54, is a widowed mother of six children. She has been growing pineapple for eleven years to make a living. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR a day, which she uses to meet the family’s needs.

Phan has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back her loans, which has helped her improve her life from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group of two in applying for a 2,800,000 KHR loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthful rice and continue raising her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to tend to her coffee crops, corn, and beans.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 43 years old and married to Rukiah. He is the father of three school-going children. His spouse adds additional income to the family. He has been in the transport business for the last 24 years earning an income of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). David is now servicing his second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy materials and thread to repair shoes.The profits he earns will be used to help the vulnerable people living within his community. He hopes for growth in his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and thread for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 61 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayalti, su población es amable y religiosa, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, lencería, productos de bazar y bodega, su tienda está ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable, Victoria es alegre, amable y trabajadora que se esfuerza para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería como ropa de temporada Otoño – Invierno que le permita ofrecerlo a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria, 61, lives in a house of her own in the district of Cayalti, where the people are kind and religious. The population works in farming, cattle raising and commerce. Cayalti is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru.
Victoria works selling clothes, lingerie, and convenience store items. Her store is located in her house and she has a considerable clientele. Victoria is cheerful, kind and hard-working and she strives to have better quality of life.
She is asking for a loan from our partner institution, Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 3,500 PEN to purchase merchandise such as clothes for the Autumn-Winter season that she will offer to her customers in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the Autumn-Winter season.

loans.name: Sharmaine Jean

texts.en: Sharmaine Jean's father is a driver and her mother is a teacher. She has three siblings and lives in Oroquieta City. She is studying in a university and has an ambition of having a better job in the future. She joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to pay her first semester tuition fees. Hoping for a bright future, Sharmaine Jean is very dedicated to her studies and is determined to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay her first semester tuition fees.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Carolina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Carolina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 59 years old and widowed with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Josefina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josefina has been farming vegetables for 10 years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
The Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province is home to Sochea, 47, and her family of four dependent children. For the past 29 years she has farmed cassava to make a living. The average income for the family is only 30,600 KHR a day, which is barely enough to support them.

Sochea leads this group of two. This will be her third loan cycle and the first for her partner. She is applying for a 2,000,000 KHR loan through VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her half of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor costs. She believes the loan will result in a better income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Path, 34, lives with his wife and three children in a village in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. Two of his children are still in school. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for almost 16 years and they supplement the family’s income by growing cassava.
 
Path has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund, he has managed to improve his livelihood and send and keep his children in school. He is requesting another loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pay for plowing the cassava field. He hopes to grow his cassava to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for plowing the cassava field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ju's Group

texts.en:
A villager of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ju is a 35-year-old married woman who has two dependent children. Currently, both of her children are going to school.

She struggles to earning a living and to pay for school expenses through cassava farming and a business selling snacks nearby her house. She has engaged in these businesses for about 14 years already.

Ju is the leader of a group of two members. This is the first time for both of them to apply for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she plans to use her portion of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees as she needs to remove grass from the farm. She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her agribusiness so that she will be able to earn a better income to improve the situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up her place of business (buy chairs and tables, paint the walls)

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba was born in 1985. She is not married and lives with her parents in the south of Tajikistan. Matluba has a special pedagogical education. She has worked for more than three years in a local school. She likes teaching and works with pleasure. Matluba always tries to improve her knowledge. Therefore, she is continuing her education at the Pedagogical University with the goal of getting a higher education. Matluba is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to pay for her tuition. She awaits your goodwill.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Segundo Gregorio

texts.es:
Segundo Gregorio tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su hijo en su propia casa del Caserío Culpon, una zona rural de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 7 años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 300 nuevos soles para la compra de animales como cuyes, patos y gallinas que le permitan ofrecerlo a un mayor precio, generando así mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Segundo Gregorio is 44 years old; he lives with his son in his own home in Caserio Culpon, a rural zone in Nueva Arica. This is a farming, business, and ranching community, located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He raises and sells barn animals. For seven years his business has been located in the back part of his home. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1,300 nuevos soles in order to purchase animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens, which will allow him to sell them at a higher price, generating better income.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to fatten up and later sell at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tp purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Edwin De Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin un experimentado agricultor con más de 20 años de experiencia, oficio aprendido por su familia.
Su familia ha trabajado desde generaciones anteriores en esas parcelas pero se han presentado con un gran inconveniente de que no han podido legalizarlas como su propiedad a pesar de a ver crecido y trabajado esas tierras por muchos años, Edwin se ha trazado como sueño legalizar sus tierras para dejarle un legado y un hogar a sus tres hijos y como padre responsable siempre se ha preocupado por la alimentación y buena educación de sus hijos y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la preparación de la tierra pues el tema de la legalización le ha costado recursos que en este momento le hacen falta para cultivar la tierra, comprara semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para asegurar un buen y sano cultivo con lo que asegurara la estabilidad económica de su familia por otro periodo de tiempo.
texts.en: Edwin is an experienced farmer, with over 20 years of experience in the trade he learned from his family. His family has worked for generations in the same plots of land but they have come across the big obstacle of being unable to make them legally their own despite having grown up and worked in them for many years. Edwin has the dream of legalizing ownership of the plots of land so that he can leave a legacy and a home for his three children. As a responsible father he has always worried about providing food and good education for his children. This is the reason for asking for a loan to prepare the land, because the ownership issue has taken up resources that he now needs to cultivate the land. With the loan money he will buy seeds, manure and fertilizers in order to ensure good and healthy crops which will guarantee the financial stability of his family for a period of time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare the land, such as manure, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 42 years old and married with seven children.

Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Analy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Analy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Earm's Group

texts.en:
Earm is a 27-year-old married woman who is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of a small child and struggles daily to make a living by raising pigs and farming cassava. She has done so for about six years.

Earm has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for one loan cycle already, and she successfully repaid it. The result of that loan was an improvement in her family’s living conditions. Now she and her partner are applying for a loan of 2,900,000 KHR. She will use her portion to pay for labor costs on the farm.

Earm hopes that the loan will enable her to lift her family’s lifestyle at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to pay for the labor fee

loans.name: Trok

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Trok is aged 21 years and married. She has two children.

To support the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming and growing cassava. The current business earns her family about 38,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Ran has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, just for this loan cycle. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and for plowing the field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her agribusiness to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plowing the field

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Samia Group

texts.en:
Samia is a group which is comprised of four members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Hana is the leader of the group. She is a 34-year-old divorced woman with two children. Her oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 7 years old. She studied until the secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. After Hana got divorced, she assumed all the responsibility for her children. She lives with her children in a rented house and her father is an officer in the army who helps her very much in the expenses of her family.

Hana doesn't have a fixed income source. Most of times, she passes with a financial crisis inside her house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house.

Hana looks forward to preparing all kinds of foods materials in her house in order to have a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33.  She works for pay at a nearby bakery and she has been photographed there. 

Alma is married and has two children who are 13 and 9 years old and practices agriculture in addition to the work for pay she does. She plants and sells in large quantities peppers, beans and vetch for animals. Now she wants to buy goats with this loan. At the moment, she does not have any animals at home and she buys dairy from neighbors but the price per kilo isn't cheap. Alma plans to sell the extra raw milk to earn some money.

A bit about Alma’s village: villagers practice mostly agriculture with plum and apple orchards being their favorite ones and also potatoes, peppers and beans.

loans.use: to buy a few goats

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Bupe is a good mother who always believes that hard work is the way to success. She is currently 50 years old and has five schooling children(Secondary and college level). She is known for being a good milk seller on her street. Bupe's cows have big calves, so she cannot produce enough liters of milk to meet people's demand as usual. She plans to buy better and healthier food to feed her cows so they give more milk to manage the demands of the market. She is also a poultry mother, keeping local chickens just for laying eggs to resell. Bupe has a plan to use the same poultry skills with little in addition to grow broilers for selling. She is really always a busy mother. She does her activities from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to get 10 liters of milk with good profit. She has been in the agricultural business since 2011.

She is requesting her ninth loan via Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Bupe used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy food to feed her cows and chickens. Bupe earned a profit, which she used to cover school fees and paid part of her home food expenses. She will use this loan to buy better food for her cows so as to give out more liters of milk and buy chicks for her new poultry business. She will use part of the loan to pay school fees. 

Bupe will share this loan with her loan group, Jitahidi Msakuzi, which has 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy better feed for her cows and to buy chicks for her new poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy knitting wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small boat and a fishing net.

loans.name: Noy's Group

texts.en:
Noy is a 27-year-old married woman and is also the mother of 2 children. Her family is residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.

As a hardworking mother who struggles to earn a living and to afford school expenses of a child who is currently going to school, Noy has been planting cassava on her farm for about 9 years already. Unfortunately, she can earn only 13,900 KHR on average from the agribusiness.

This is the second loan cycle for both Noy and her partner to request a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a group, they apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, of which Noy owns the portion of 800,000 KHR. As the representative of her group, she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for land plowing and labor fees for her farm as she hopes to increase the yield. She believes that the loan enables her to be able to earn a higher income to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for land plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Khudoynazar

texts.en:
Khudoynazar is 62 years old. He lives in a small village in south Tajikistan with his wife and eight children. He is a very hardworking smart man. He has raised his children in the spirit of nationalism. 

He has been involved with animal sales for more than 15 years. He mainly feeds goats. Though he is old, he works because his family needs money. He wants to develop a business but doesn't have the money to buy more goats. This loan will help him increase the number of goats and make a profit to improve his living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goats to increase working capital.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 57-year-old mother of two adult-age children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. To earn additional income, Catalina raises hogs for sale. 

Catalina aims to expand her pigpen and raise more pigs, but has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. 

Through this loan, Catalina believes that she will increase her income and hopes that she will uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, junto con su menor hijo, la comunidad es tranquila, de clima variado se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de panca y crianza de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales que le permitan engordarlo y ofrecerlo a mayor precio y una segunda parte para la compra de materiales para cercar el corral de los mismo que le permitan tener una mejor distribución para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old. She lives in the Oyotun district with her young son. The community is tranquil; the climate is varied. It is a farming, business, and ranching community, located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Vilma sells maize leaves and raises animals, such as ducks, roosters, and hens. For several years, her business has been located in the rear part of her home. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of animals. She will fatten them up and sell them at a higher price. She will use the other part of the loan to purchase materials to fence in the animal pens, which will allow her to have better distribution and to grow.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and materials to build their pens.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 50 years old and a married mother of eight children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmela's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Carmela has requested a PHP 9360 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to expand her enterprise and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang, 32, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Seang and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for over than 10 years, earning about 31,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. 

Seang has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Seang is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business

loans.name: Enie

texts.en:
Enie is 41 years old and has nine children. Enie is married and four of her children are in school.

Enie and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Enie is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,250 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Enie has been with NWTF since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Enie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 39-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing that her cocoa farming harvests were not yielding enough to cover her daily expenditure, she started a food stall to improve her income. Although she manages to run the two activities, she is challenged with poor storage facilities for her perishable food and competition, yet she wishes to enlarge her business to a big vegetable grocery store. Rose intends to use the loan from HOFOKAM to buy cocoa, rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Claudia Melissa

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad, y vive en Tarapoto con su familia.
Tiene un pequeño hijo por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un mejor futuro y una educación de calidad.
Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la producción y venta de "Churros". Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de excelente calidad.
Es la segunda vez que Kiva confía en ella y esta vez utilizará la ayuda brindada para abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de Cebiche con el que obtendrá un ingreso adicional y así más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Claudia is a young entrepreneur. She is 24 years old and lives in Tarapoto with her family.

She has a small son whom she fights for day after day to be able to give him a better future and a quality education.

For more than three years, she has made and sold churros. This is going very well for her because she is a hard working and responsible person. Above all, it is because she sells high quality products.

This is the second time Kiva has trusted her, and this time, she will use the support to open a small business selling ceviche. Through this, she will gain additional income and be able to realize her biggest dream sooner - to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase goods to start her ceviche-selling business.

loans.name: Aurelio Cesar

texts.es:
Aurelio Cesar tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto con su conyugue y su menor hijo de 5 años de edad en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se desempeña como maestro de construcción civil, realizando trabajos llenado de columnas, pegado de ladrillos para pared, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera y arreglos para su vivienda y de esta manera vivir en un lugar agradable.
texts.en:
Aurelio Cesar is 59 years old. He lives in his own house, made of rough materials, with his wife and their 5-year-old child. They live in the Pucará district, which has a hot climate. The community makes its living in agriculture, stockbreeding, and the commercial sector. It is located in the Jaén province, which is part of the Cajamarca region, the northern mountain range of Peru.

He works as a civil general contractor, doing projects that involve columns and wall bricks. He has requested a 1,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase wood to make repairs to his home, so that he can live in a nicer house.

loans.use: to purchase wood and make repairs to his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction materials to build her home.

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jeramie works hard to support his family.

He has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi. Jeramie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for his restaurant.

Jeramie has been sustaining his business activities through his past 14 loans from NWTF. Jeramie hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business and continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto con su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a las labores de jornaleria desde hace varios años, trabajando las parcelas de sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una moto que le permita trasladar a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 43 years old. He lives with his son in the Oyotún district. His community works in agriculture, stockbreeding, and the commercial sector. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked as a day laborer for many years on the plots owned by his neighbors and the residents of his district. He has requested a 2,500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a motorcycle that will allow him to transport passengers to neighboring areas, so he can make additional money to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to carry his passengers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 38 years old, married to Samson, and the mother of four schoolgoing children. Her spouse adds additional income to the family. She has been selling fish for the last five years, earning an income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is now servicing her second loan, of 15,000 KES, from VisionFund Kenya, and she intends to buy more fish to sell. The profit she earns will be used to help vulnerable people living in the community. She hopes for growth in his business

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Laurensius

texts.en: Laurensius is a 32-year-old man, married to Maria, 28, a housewife. They are blessed with three children, namely Andreas, 9, an elementary school student; and two who are not ready for school yet--Febi, 5; and the youngest, Rivaldo, 2. Laurensius has been a builder for years. He usually goes to work at 7 a.m. and gets home at 7 p.m. From his earned income he has been able to buy a plot of land to build a house for his family, since they live in a rented house. Recently, he and his family moved into his newly built house, which is not far from his previous residence. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to finish building the kitchen area. This situation drives him to ask an individual loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on materials, such as cement, bricks and sand, to build his kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as cement, bricks and sand, to build his kitchen.

loans.name: Kelis Yogenia

texts.es: Un sueño de vender sus cultivos en otras ciudades es el deseo que alimenta a la señora Kelis quien junto a su esposo monto su negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años pues querían realizar una actividad económica que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos y estar pendientes de su crecimiento y evolución, trabajan todos los días alimentados por su sueño de exportar sus cultivos a diferentes ciudades del país y pro que no a otros países y en base a este anhelo solicitan un crédito para acercarse más al sueño para consolidar su empresa para aumentar las ventas y poder creer que algún día exportaran sus cultivos a otras ciudades. El crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y semillas para preparar la tierra, motivados y con ganas de hacer cada día mejor las cosas pues su deseo es inquebrantable.
texts.en: Kelis and her husband sustain themselves on the dream of selling their produce in other cities. They started their business about five years ago because they wanted to find paying work that would let them be close to their children, present for their growth and development. They work every day to feed their dream of exporting produce to other cities in the country -- and why not? -- to other countries as well!  Rooted in this desire, they are requesting this loan to move one step closer to their dream of consolidating their business, expanding sales, and you can believe, one day exporting their crops to other cities. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds to prepare the land. Motivated and driven by the thirst to make things better every day, their dream is unquenchable.

loans.use: achieve her and her husband's dream of exporting their produce to other cities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Mirije

texts.en: Mirije is a 55-year-old Egyptian and was photographed with her grandchildren inside the home where she wants to make some repairs, with this loan, particularly in the kitchen and balcony. Mirije and her family live in a village, unlike the majority of her ethnic community members, who live either in suburbia or in the city. She engages in agriculture for a living, planting and selling  potatoes, beans, corn and wheat to wholesale buyers, whereas her husband works as a night watchman man in a metals factory. They are the parents of three children and grandparents of six grandchildren. In the village where they live, agriculture is very prevalent; in particular, people grow wheat, corn, onions, potatoes and fodder, and they also have cherry, plum and apple orchards.

loans.use: to make minor repairs to their poorly built family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an industrial sausage maker

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand his agricultural produce and help his neighbors through farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a home so that he can live independently

loans.name: Tara

texts.en: Tara is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 3. Many years ago Tara established her beauty salon business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy makeup for her business. In the future, Tara plans to uplift the financial condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to get her land ready such as composts, fertilizers and seeds since she needs to generate the resources to provide her two daughters with an education.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 45 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 14 años y 11 años de edad. Luis es un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Desde hace 10 años se gana la vida por medio de la confección de uniformes y calzado artesanal. Es así como mantiene la economía de su familia. Luis desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto y para enladrillar el piso de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso, hierro y ladrillo.
texts.en: Luis is 45 years old and lives with his partner and their 2 children who are 14 and 11 years old. Luis is an enterprising man who is responsible and hardworking. For 10 years, he has been earning a living making uniforms and handmade shoes. This is how he supports his family. Luis wants to improve the condition of his home and so he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in constructing a room and paving the floor of his house. He will use the requested funds to buy cement, sand, paving tiles, iron, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paving tiles, iron, and brick to build a room and pave the floor of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kiosk stock such as soap, shampoo, detergent, instant noodles, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to purchase more educational materials for her daughter

loans.name: Franklin Isaac

texts.es:
Franklin de 18 años de edad, solamente estudio 4° grado, está soltero, él trabaja como soldador con su papá y también maneja un pequeño taller de bicicletas y trabaja como fontanero en la comunidad. 

Él aprendió el oficio de soldador trabajando con su papá, así como también a reparar bicicletas, trabaja en su casa de habitación y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo porque veía que a su padre le iba muy bien. Necesita el dinero para comprar una motocicleta, quiere hacer su propio historial crediticio, a él le ayudara mucho la motocicleta para transportarse cuando le salen trabajos fuera de casa. 

Franklin sueña con tener su propio taller de estructuras metálicas y a futuro con la experiencia obtenida tener la facilidad de depender de sí mismo.
texts.en:
Franklin, 18 years old, only studied up to the 4th grade.  He is single and works as a welder with his father and also runs a small bicycle shop and works as a plumber in the community. 

He learned the skills of welding by working with his dad, and also bicycle repair. He works at his home and decided to do this work because he saw that it was successful for his father. He needs the money to purchase a motorcycle; he wants to make his own credit history. A motorcycle will help him a lot by carrying him when he goes to jobs away from his house. 

Franklin dreams of having his own metalworking shop and in the future, after getting some experience, of having the ability to support himself.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle; he wants to create his own credit history

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron and pay for labor to build a room for use as kitchen and living room

loans.name: Gustavo Manuel

texts.es:
Darle felicidad a la familia es el objetivo que se traza el señor Gustavo quien también piensa en el cómo beneficiado puesto que es quien se levanta todos los días muy temprano en la madrugada para trabajar sus tierras y cuidar su ganado, pero como persona humilde se enfrente con un inconveniente ye s la falta de capital para trabajar la tierra lo que le genera pérdidas de capital pues en varias ocasiones desperdicia tierra y campo por no tener el capital para preparar la tierra para el cultivo.
Gustavo solicita un crédito para preparar la tierra y poder sacar provecho de sus cosechas mejorando su negocio y permitiéndole brindar por más tiempo la felicidad a su familia, sonrisas de tener una buena vida y un plato de comida para alimentarlos y tenerlos siempre desbordante de alegría
texts.en:
Making his family happy is Gustavo's goal and he also thinks about this when he gets up very early every day, with the dawn, to work in his fields and care for his livestock. As he is from a humble background he finds himself in a difficult position as he doesn't have the capital to work the land which sometimes results in a financial loss and land goes to waste because he doesn't have the capital to prepare it for cultivation. 
Gustavo is requesting a loan to prepare the land and so to take advantage of improved crops and a strengthened business. This will enable him to devote more time to his family's happiness, so they can have smiles and a good life and a plate of food to sustain them and to always be overflowing with joy.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare the land such as manure and seeds as he wants to make use of 100% of his available land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Cubwenge Ii Group

texts.fr:
Pierre Claver fait partie du groupe  CubwengeII  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 40 ans et est marié  à A. Marie  une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce  de haricot, petit pois et du riz depuis  15 ans. 

Il est son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot,de petit pois et du riz à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Pierre Claver belongs to group Cubwenge II and lives in Gitega. He is 40 years old and married to A. Marie, a farmer. Together they have six children, ages 4 to 15; three of the children go to school.

He has been selling beans, peas, and rice for fifteen years.

This is his fifth loan with Turame. With the loan granted through Kiva, he will increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of beans, peas, and rice, to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to buy in bulk beans, peas, and rice to retail.

loans.name: Lucia Jannette

texts.es:
La señora Lucia tuvo que enfrentar el fallecimiento de su padre hace algunos meses y esto ocasiono que su negocio de confección a terceros comenzara a decaer.
Con ayuda de dos empleados y con la fuerza que siempre la ha caracterizado comenzó con el proceso de fortalecimiento y afianzamiento de su actividad.
Hoy en día tiene grandes esperanzas y sueños que planea cumplir.
Por esta razón solicita ayuda para la compra de una maquina filetedora, plana y una maquina familiar, esto le permitirá tener un mejor volumen de producción y tendrá el poder de tomar muchas decisiones importantes para su negocio.
Hoy en día confecciona uniformes para empresas y colegios.
El préstamo le brindara la oportunidad de volver a prender sus ilusiones y sus ganas de luchar por un futuro más prospero para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia had to face the death of her father a few months ago, which led to the decline of her business making garments.  

With the help of two employees and with the strength that has always characterized her, she has begun the process of strengthening and reinforcing her business. Today, she has big hopes and dreams that she plans to achieve. 

For this reason, Lucia is requesting this loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, an industrial sewing machine, and a household sewing machine. This will allow her to produce at a higher volume.  This will give her the power to make some important decisions for her business. 

Lucia produces uniforms for businesses and high schools. This loan will give her the opportunity to return to pursuing her dreams and her desire to fight for a more prosperous future for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, and industrial sewing machine and a household sewing machine.

loans.name: Shanta Singh

texts.en:
Shanta Singh is 33 years old. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 4. Many years ago, she established her grocery goods business. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Shanta Singh plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Rama Shahi

texts.en:
Rama Shahi is 50 years old. She is married and has two children aged 25 and 33. Many years ago, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy chicks for her business. In the future, Rama Shahi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and iron to build a contention wall.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a thirty-four-year-old woman, married with four children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Faith depended on small scale cocoa farming for a long time but she could not get enough to cater for the necessities of the family. She decided to start a small food stall in the market around her home area from the small savings of her cocoa plantation to improve on the household income. Though challenged with high costs of transport to the market place and poor roads, Faith is determined to work hard and use the loan to buy fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Saira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Saira una mujer de 51 años la cual tiene un feliz matrimonio del cual nacieron tres hijos mayores de edad todos.
Saira logro montar una pequeña tienda de barrio gracias a una liquidación que recibió y nos ahorros que tenía pues a pesar de su edad quería sentirse productiva, realizar una actividad que le permitiera sentirse vida y poder ayudar a su esposo con la carga del hogar ya que un dinero extra nunca cae mal y más para una familia que ha vivido toda su vida humildemente pero con trabajo han mejorado sus condiciones de vida. Ahora ya que tiene la tienda tiene ambición y tiene sueños, la señora Saira quiere convertir su pequeña tienda en un futuro no muy lejano en un mini-mercado con el que pueda emplear a una persona y sabe que para logar este cometido tiene que mejorar considerablemente sus ventas por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido con la cual iniciara su sueño de ir transformando su tienda en un mini-mercado dando su primer paso hacia el progreso.
texts.en:
Saira is 51, happy married, and the mother of three adult children. She was able to open a small grocery store with the money she saved after receiving a settlement. Saira wanted to undertake an endeavor that would, despite her age, make her feel productive and alive as well as help her husband meet their household expenses. Saira and her family can always use extra money as she, her husband, and children have always had a very humble lifestyle that's improved only gradually through hard work. 

Now that she's established the store, Saira has goals and dreams. She wants in the near future to expand her store into a mini-market, which would be bigger and require hiring an employee. Saira knows that she needs to boost her sales sharply in order to meet her goals. She's therefore applying for a loan to purchase inventory that will allow her to take the first step toward realizing the expansion of her store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as biscuits, bread, grains, and groceries that will allow her to start a transformation of her business into a minimarket.

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de San Vicente junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 2 años trabaja en un Tragamonedas y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, entusiasta, honesta y porque es muy dedicado a su trabajo.
Oscar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá continuar con sus estudios superiores de Psicología para más adelante convertirse en un gran profesional, poder conseguir un trabajo bien remunerado y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is an enterprising young man. He is 19 years old, single, and lives in the district of San Vicente with his family.
He has been working in a slot machine arcade for almost 2 years and is doing very well because he is responsible, hardworking, enthusiastic, and honest;  and  because he is very dedicated to his work. 
Oscar is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to continue with his psychology studies so that he can later on become a professional and be able to get a well paid job and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in psychology.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 39 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus seis hijos en su poder de 21,19,16,13, 9 y 6 años de edad, de los cuales los cuatro últimos estudian en la escuela de Caserío Vista Florida , una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cafeto desde hace 3 años de la variedad catimor; cultiva 2 has de su propiedad, junto con su esposa se tiene una vaca que ordeñando por las mañanas para ofrecer la leche a sus vecino o mediante queso que su esposa prepara artesanalmente. Son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos con la venta de leche y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente is 39 years old. He has a stable home where he lives with his wife and their six children (ages 21, 19, 16, 13, 9, and 6). The youngest four children attend a school in the village of Vista Florida, a rural area in the District of Santo Tomas. The residents are primarily involved in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Vicente is a farmer who specializes in growing coffee. For the past three years, he has been cultivating the catimor variety. Vicente has two hectares of land that he owns. He and his wife also have a cow that is milked in the mornings. The milk is either sold to their neighbor or used by his wife to prepare handmade cheese. His family is close-knit and puts forth effort in the work that they perform.

Vicente is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 4,500 PEN so that he can buy a cow. This will enable him to earn more revenue from selling milk, which generates more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: BINTA est une femme qui vit avec sa famille dans un quartier de  la place. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus pour femme et elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans cette activité. Etant dans son 4ème, elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des tissus et ensuite les revendre. Elle gère ses dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. BINTA voudrait aussi à l’avenir effectuer des voyages dans la sous région (Mauritanie – Mali) afin de pouvoir diversifier ses marchandises et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Binta is a woman living with her family in one of the local neighborhoods. She is married and a mother. She is in the business of selling fabrics destined to women; she has twenty years of experience in her activity.

This is her fourth loan; she is requesting this amount to purchase fabrics intended for resale. She is in charge of her family’s daily expenses. She starts her day at 9am and ends it at 6pm.

In the future, Binta would also like to travel through the region (Mauritania and Mali) in order to diversify her merchandise and increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, solamente estudio 6° grado, ya que muy pronto tuvo que comenzar a trabajar para ayudar a los ingresos del hogar.  Está casado y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales una está casada y los otros dos estudian. 

José desde hace muchos años también se ha dedicado a la ganadería, ya que es una buena fuente de ingresos y alimentación para su familia. Necesita el préstamo para sembrar maicillo para el pasto de los animales, considera que tiene que pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra, semilla de maicillo, herbicidas y pesticidas. 

Dice que él es conforme con que sus hijos sean educados, aunque no saquen una profesión, solo quiere tener la oportunidad de verlos crecer.
texts.en:
José, 55 years old, only studied up to the 6th grade, since very early on he had to start working to help with the household income.  He is married and has 3 children, of whom one is married and the other two are students. 

Many years ago, José decided to work in animal husbandry, since that is a good source of income and food for his family.  He needs the loan to plant millet as forage for the animals. He also has to pay labor costs to prepare the soil, and purchase millet seeds, herbicides and pesticides.

He says that he is satisfied that his children are educated, even if they don't get a profession; he just wants the opportunity to see them grow.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to prepare the land, purchase millet seeds, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an industrial range, a large frying pan, a bucket of oil, ripe plantain, and farmer's cheese, and also to improve her community.

loans.name: Antonia De Jesus

texts.es: Antonia tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos de 20 años, 7 años, 15 años y 13 años de edad; es viuda por lo que ella es la que lleva la responsabilidad del hogar. Antonia se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 12 años. EL negocio lo tiene en el mercado central de su localidad. Antonia desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina para reparar la vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada.
texts.en: Antonia is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her four children, 20, 7, 15, and 13 years old.  She is a widow, so she has to carry the responsibility for the home. Antonia has worked selling pupusas for 12 years. She has her business in the central market in her area. Antonia wishes to improve their living conditions, so she asked for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of metal sheeting to repair the house which is deteriorated.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and pay labor costs to repair the house.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, who started a bar, lodge and hotel business in 2007 to cater to her family demands like school requirements, supplements her income with a stationery shop and poultry project. She is hardworking and wishes to facilitate paying her children's school fees. In her businesses, she is faced with a challenge of competition and high taxes imposed on her businesses.

Justine is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y dos sobrinas de 15 y 18 años de edad. José es jornalero, cultiva maíz y caña, etc. Es un hombre trabajador y comprometido con su familia. Con la finalidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que esta deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y pagará la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: José is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and two nieces, 15 and 18 years old. José is a day laborer; he grows corn, sugar cane, etc. He is a hard-working man and is committed to his family. With the end goal to improve their living conditions, he has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof of the house since it is deteriorated. With the amount he has requested, he will purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and will pay labor costs for the construction.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and to pay the labor costs to repair his roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Eufemio Jose

texts.es:
Tener casa propia es el objetivo que se traza una pareja al aventurarse juntas en busca de la felicidad y es que tener un lugar al cual llegar tranquiliza a cualquier persona y este ha sido el sueño de Eufemio quien junto con su esposa hace dos años se trazaron la meta de adquirir su propio hogar ya sea que les toque comprar ladrillo por ladrillo.
Eufemio es un comercializador de agua y tiene una compra y venta de cerdos con los que espera poder cumplir este sueño pues a sus 50 años de edad las posibilidades se le van cerrando pero Eufemio tiene la fe que con esfuerzo y trabajo lograra su objetivo.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de Cerdos que le permita seguir operando junto a su esposa y acercarse cada vez más a su sueño y poder vivir junto con ella los largos años que le quedan de vida
texts.en:
Purchasing a home is the goal of this couple, who have set out in search of happiness. Having a place to call home would calm anyone and this has been Eufemio's dream. For the past two years, Eufemio and his wife have set out with the goal of purchasing their own home since they have to build it brick by brick.

Eufemio sells water and has a business selling pigs. He hopes to accomplish his goal because, at the age of 50, the possibilities for him are diminishing. Eufemio has faith that with effort and hard work, he will achieve his goal.

He requests a loan to purchase pigs, which will allow him to continue working with his wife and move closer towards his dream so he can live with his wife for the many years that they have remaining together.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to work with his wife in their family business.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Quiere Al Niño” y está conformado por 07 socios progresistas. Dina de 55 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta y distribución de especerías a los mercados así como ají molido. Tiene el deseo de contar con un puesto de venta para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ají, ajos, y rocoto. El grupo “Quiere Al Niño” Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Dina se encuentra de pie es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chaleco rosado.
texts.en: This is the "Quiere al Niño" group, and is is made up of 7 progressive members.  Dina, 55 years old, is separated and has 1 dependent child. She works selling and distributing spices in the markets, such as ground chili pepper. She has the desire to have a stall to be able to provide for her customers. She asked for this loan to purchase chili pepper, garlic and rocoto pepper. The "Quiere al Niño" group thanks the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Dina is the one standing, second from the left, wearing a pink vest.

loans.use: to purchase chili pepper, garlic and rocoto peppers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 60-year-old single mother of seven children who are still going to school. She has been running a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods to her customers in the community. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She has been in this business for the last four years and she is applying for her second loan to add more stock of maize flour, soaps and beverages to sell.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes for growth in her business

loans.use: to add more stock of maize flour, soaps and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticide to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Maria Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada como ropa y artículos para el hogar desde hace 33 años. Actividad con la que logro sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles todo lo que necesitaban para vivir.
Hoy en día sus hijos son independientes gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, sin embargo ella aun continúa con su trabajo comercial para vivir ya que no le gusta depender de nadie.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de mercancía para las próximas fechas especiales. Este dinero le dará la oportunidad de aumentar su inventario y tener a la mano los productos para sus clientes.
Es una mujer luchadora y sabia, siempre ha tenido claro quién es y para donde va en su vida.
texts.en:
Maria works selling various products such as clothes and home goods and has been doing this for 33 years. By doing this, she was able to bring up her children and offer them all that they needed to live.
Today, her children are grown up, thanks to their mother's guidance. However, she still continues her business as she doesn't like to be dependent on anyone. 
She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store for the upcoming holidays. This money will enable her to increase her inventory and to have products on hand for her customers. 
She is a hardworking and wise woman who has always been clear about who she is and where she is going in life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store such as clothes and home goods.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven de 29 años de edad, dice que solamente logro estudiar hasta  cuarto grado, lamenta no haber tenido la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, ya tiene 12 años de estar con su esposa pero hace dos años se casaron, y hasta la fecha han procreado 3 hijos de las edades de 13,12 y 4 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a cuidar la casa, a los oficios domésticos y también ayuda a su esposo cuando puede en los trabajos de la milpa, los tres hijos van a la escuela.

Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años Pedro se desempeña como agricultor,  antes trabajaba como ayudante pero desde que se acompañó decidió que le era más rentable hacer su propia siembra para obtener sus propios granos básicos para su hogar, esto lo aprendió de su padre quien fue quien le enseño como ganarse la vida por sus propios medios; de esta manera a decidido que en este año va a sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol.  El lugar donde siembra no es propia,  así que le toca rentar la tierra que le cuesta $50.00 para trasladarse a su trabajo lo hace caminado, ya que está a unos 10 minutos de su casa y lo hace caminando 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, un litro de herbicida, pago a las personas que le ayudaran a cultivar maíz y frijol. Con esto él se verá beneficiado de gran manera,  ya que mejorara su calidad de vida llevando más granos a su casa para dejar para el consumo y otra parte para vender y pagar el crédito.

Sus sueños son confiando en Dios que le dará salud a él y a su familia,  también que un día podrá cultivar más y con la ayuda de su familia, sacar a delante sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 29-year-old young man. He says that he only studied until the fourth grade and unfortunately has not had the opportunity to continue his studies. He has been in a relationship with his wife for 12 years and they got married two years ago. They have three children, ages 13, 12, and 4. Pedro's wife dedicates her time to taking care of the work around the house and, when she can, she also works with him in the fields. All of their children attend school. 

Approximately 15 years ago, Pedro decided to become a farmer. Before, he had worked as an assistant but since he is married now, he decided it would be more profitable to raise his own crops and grow food for his home. Pedro learned this trade from his father, who showed him how to earn a living on his own. That is how Pedro decided that this year he would sow 7,000 square meters of corn and beans. The land he sows is not his so he has to rent it. It costs him $50.00. He commutes to work on foot since his land is located 10 minutes away from his house. 

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO will help him buy 4 sacks of compost, a liter of weedkiller, and to pay workers to help him to cultivate corn and beans. This loan will be a great help to him and will improve his quality of life since he will be able to take home more food for his family and use the rest to sell and pay back this loan. 

Pedros dreams are trusting in God that he will bless his family with good health as well as to one day cultivate more so that, with the help of his family, he will move forward in his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of compost, a liter of weedkiller, and to pay workers to help him to cultivate corn and beans.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo used the previous loan to construct grass-thatched shades for his customers. He is still running a guest house, and faces the challenge of competition. However, he hopes to fully established a guest house that meets the standard of serving tourists in town. Paul needs a loan to buy materials for painting his guest house.

loans.use: to buy materials for painting his guest house.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a 28-year-old woman, married to Yoksan, 34. They are blessed with three children: Anastasia, 3, an elementary school student, Juanita, 5, in early childhood education, and Junior, 1 year old. 

Johana has a farm that is located not so far from her residence. Currently, Johana cultivates tomatoes and basil. Actually, Johana also cultivates beans and corn, but they had already been harvested and sold to the market. 

A few months ago, there was a plant disease attacking the farm near her farm; this situation worried her about her farm. She wanted to buy the pesticide for her plants, but she does not have much money to do so. Therefore, she requests an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on three different pesticides for her farm.

loans.use: to buy three different pesticides for her farm.
